Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but---”
Reviews.Author: Will E
Reviews.Content: I love the Ritz. I love the showers, the bathrooms, the linens, the location, the concierge. All great. The rooms vary in quality, but the good rooms are really good. REALLY good. Prices are ridiculous, but frankly that isn't as important. The food and beverages, in all of the restaurants, is remarkable. Pierre, in the Hemingway bar, is fun. He stood out. I had a problem I'd never encountered on my last trip. Money was taken out of my bag. The money I'd left in the room safe was fine, but 1400 was taken out of a secret pocket in my bag. Even stranger, 1600 was left behind. My assumption is that the thief didn't expect to be noticed, and remains an employee. Put your valuables in the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Hemingway is quite right, as is Oscar Wilde”
Reviews.Author: jane s
Reviews.Content: When in Paris, there is absolutely no reason not to stay at The Ritz - other than lack of money, said Earnest. And had Oscar been in less impecunious circumstances at the time, he would have chosen to expire here instead of in poverty, though with humour, across the Seine in the 6th. It is nothing but the best. If you can, take choose the Fitzgerald Suite - unless you really want to splash out and try the Chanel Suite. The pool is a highlight, complete with underwater music; the Hemingway Bar one of Paris's best with its fabulous cocktails (and staff!!), all raconteurs in their own writes, but watch out for the dragons doing pedicure at the spa. They get a little carried away with the pumice. Ouch! Some lovely ideas along the shopping arcade within, too. L'Espadon defies description in creativity and excellence. As famous as this restaurant is, however, it does not get carried away with itself - at a very large family Christmas celebration a couple of years ago the staff matched our joviality and celebrations with the best of their own humour amongst all the style and pzzazz of the service. And the decorations ... !! Even if you only do it once ... . That'd be your innocent downfall. Once would not be enough. And if perchance you overindulge, there is the hotel's limousine to assist you on your way home - if you are not in residence.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence all the way. Expensive but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: HPBKraaijeveld
Reviews.Content: This place is obviously synonimous with luxury of the highest standard. Been here several times over the years. Every time I/we returned it was wonderfull again. They keep a good file and remember your preferences the next time you visit. One of the first times we went there we celibrrated our wedding anniversary. Next year we came they just remembered the event, treating us on champagne and a sumptious cake. Spacious rooms, the best beds ever, excellent personalised service, very good spa; one of the best massages I ever had. Swimmingpool is stunning. Breakfast (obviously one of the most expensive breakfasts you can have) is great. If you can afford it, just go and splurge; it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for the smoke”
Reviews.Author: Sunny Sally
Reviews.Content: Needs a good cleaning. Everything smells like cigarettes. YUCK ! The food and drinks are tasty but very expensive. The Hemmingway Bar is fun. The best part is the beautiful old swimming pool. They make you wear an old fashioned bathing cap in it. It's like being back in time. The bathroom was peachy coloured and has gold faucets. Very interesting ! I The location however is second to none. The Louve, Tuillery Garden, Champs d'Ellysse at your door step.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence - but at a price”
Reviews.Author: S_Montgomery63
Reviews.Content: Truly a wonderful experience. Pretty much faultless in every aspect, and if you are fortunate enough to be in the position where "money doesn't matter" then this would no doubt be the automatic choice if staying in Paris but..............they have no shame about what they charge!

Reviews.Title: “Not regrettable even when you pay an exorbitant price.”
Reviews.Author: RNVR
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Paris is a remarkable part of history, not only Parisian but world's history. A number of facts that changed history was planned or decided at Ritz. Despite the fact of staying at an important historic palace the hotel is beautiful and glamorous – could have some modern touch, but art pieces don’t change. And the location is the best: few steps from Opera, Louvre, Madeleine and shopping areas. The bell door was helpful and very welcoming. As we arrived he conducted us to the reception and from that time we already felt like a guest. Unlike my expectation our room took almost one hour to be ready and they said we had to wait. I expected a different reception but everyone were so friendly we didn’t mind the delay. We used that time to walk through the elegant hotel halls, including a quick look at the 300 euro menu restaurant, the charming lobby bar and the huge shops corridor on the lower floor that leaded to Rue de Cambon entrance, where the wonderful Ritz Bar is located. We had time also to visit the wonderful spa, where the marvelous swimming pool and Ivo Pitangui’s dermatologic creams were some of the attractions. When the room was ready someone was looking for us to introduce us to the hotel. There was two ways to go to the room: the stylish stairway beside the lobby and a small elevator backward. The room was very classy and elegant and the classic furniture with calming colors took us to a timeless Paris. The bed was incredibly comfortable – I mean it – and there were some modern features like the big TV with more than a hundred channels (half of them were from Middle East), IPod dock station (unfortunately there was a strange noise and I turned it off) and useful lights controls. The small balcony with flowers with a view to the garden and the gorgeous chandelier gave the special romantic touch to the room. The bathroom was not glamorous but had its charming like the tap with an interesting duck shape. Beside the bathtub there were two bells to call the help (male or female) – in my opinion not useful but funny. There were keys to call help beside the bed too. Pink towels, robe and slippers were ultra-comfortable and cosmetics were La Prairie. The concierge was very patient and got us exactly the kind of restaurant we wanted and an incredible table with a panoramic view to the entire restaurant (note that was a 2 star Michelin restaurant and the reservation was made with no more than one hour in advance). Actually some of the concierges were excessively arrogant but some of them are amazing. Keep trying. Breakfast was served at the starred and glamorous restaurant with some menu combinations or separated items, instead of buffet. It costs around 30 to 60 euros. Everything was delicious, from the breads, served warm, to crepes and omelets, although not surprising. As every guest is exclusive it was not necessary to ask a bill to be signed – they knew our room number – we just had to leave as soon as we decide. Not to be missed is the Ritz Bar, especially when there is a DJ. The 30 euro cocktails were perfectly prepared and the fashionable ambiance was delightful. Different from the entire stay, as uncomfortable as waiting one hour to get the room was the check out. They telephoned us and knocked on the door at noon to check if we would really leave. Of course we would not stay the whole afternoon but the plan was to leave between noon and 1 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: NYCDesign78
Reviews.Content: Can see that it does need updating, but hope they don't ruin it with the renovation. Will be very sad to see it closed for so long! The service is so phenomenal and the rooms so gorgeous. And, nothing is better than arriving to the Place Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: joneschristopher975
Reviews.Content: Been there for second time.We consider Ritz the best hotel in Paris.Great architecture,fantastic location and excellent service.Place Vendome is very close to everything that anybody should search in Paris.Famous monuments , nice brand shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Our Third Time--The Ritz IS Paris!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerbill
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is the iconic and historic hotel ideally located on Place Vendome. We would not think of staying any place other than here. It is truly spectacular. It is due to close for a two year renovation. We are sure it will be better than ever, and look so foward to returning! Please see my attached photos to help you appreciate this Parsian "gem".

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: marc w
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 night there with my fiancee and we have to admit that everything from our arrival to our departure was just fabulous! The architecture is authentic, the food is delicious and the service.... not one fault! The room service manager elias made us live an unbelievable experience were he made us feel we were the only guests and nothing was impossible for him (though we have lots of food restrictions and are very picky on food) The lady at the reception was up for our challenges and made our dreams come true. The ritz is still a living legend and is totally representative of Paris. To do once in a life time!

Reviews.Title: “My 50 birthday”
Reviews.Author: DevonRiddler
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to paris for my 50th birthday on arrival at the airport she surprised me with a two night stay at the Rita Paris. It lived up to my expectations from arriving to departing 5-star service by everyone at the Ritz. Our room wasnt ready but they took us to the terrace bar and gave us complimentry drinks until it was. What a elegant room complimentary cake with happy birthday on it. We went to the Lido in the evening conceirage arranged transport in their Jaguar xj. we are looking forward to going again on our annivesary.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, relaxing, devine and thats just High Team at The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: REHAN07860
Reviews.Content: After planning a trip To Paris for New Years, I also decided to book High Tea at the Paris Ritz on New Years Day before we were due to fly back Heathrow, London. On the day we checked out of our beautiful Sofitel hotel in La Defense Paris at 3pm as they had allowed us a late checkout. We were due at the Ritz for High Tea at 4pm. The journey took us about 30 minutes by cab. The Ritz Paris is a beautiful hotel. We arrived outside the hotel and immediate two men (porters) came over to take our luggage and stored it whilst we had our tea. As we were early, we walked around the hotel and looked at the Rotz boutique. We were allowed to walk around freely in our casual clothes, something you could never do in the London Ritz where my wife and I stayed for our wedding night. When the time came for tea, we were seated at a loved table in the Salon d’ete by the grand piano where a man was playing tunes. We did have to wait for a bit (circa ten minutes) to be asked what we wanted to drink – my wife had an amaaazing hot chocolate which I can only describe as pure melted Cadbury’s chocolate! I was boring and had coke on the rocks with lemon. The finger sandwiches, scones, preserve, clotted cream and cakes were divine! The staff and service was excellent – they were very caring, always wanting to top up the hot chocolate. When I asked if I could buy some cakes to take back to London for my family they brought in a beautifully presented box with cakes as a gift from them to us! The only criticism I have is that when I booked the High Tea on the phone from the UK I was quoted 45 Euros but they called me on 30/12 to confirm the booking. They said that the High Tea had been moved to the Salon D’ete and that the price would be 65 Euros. Overall it was a lovely, relaxing experience and the staff were wonderful, thank you Ritz Paris, see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious but a museum”
Reviews.Author: stephenanstiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 30th birthday, arrived early (around 1pm) and got the impression that a room wasnt available because i was early rather than the rooms were all dirty from the night before. Only spoke to one person on the front desk who while not unpleasant did not give the service i expect from such a luxurious hotel, everyone else though gave excellent service. The public areas of the hotel were beautiful, decorated as you would expect for such a famous historic hotel. The pool was large though lacking the same style as the rest fo the hotel. As it was my birthday they gave us a free upgrade and placed a cake with candle in the room which was really apreciated. The room was large and spacious, the decor was a bit too old fashioned and took a while to settle into, it felt more like it was preserving the theme of the origional hotel than actually being a functioning hotel in the 21st century. I could imagine recreationist happily wandering around in period clothes, as if it were a museum, and because of this i didnt feel comfortable for some time in my room. Despite this i think it would be hard to find another hotel decorated in such a way, and is one of the reasons i chose the Ritz paris. The room was clean, had modern amenities such as flat screen tvs and music players. The bathroom was imaculate with the famous golden swan taps. I would request a room with a view in future as the inner courtyard was a bit gloomy on a winters day. Corridoors are a bit of a labarynth but add to the charm of the hotel. Had afternoon tea in the hotel, was one of the best ive had and nicer than the Ritz in London, service from the Maitre de was exceptional. As they knew it was my birthday they lowered the lights and braught a cake out, with the pianist playing happy birthday, a lovely touch. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel for a special occasion then this is the only place to stay in Paris, if you are looking for something a bit more comfortable then maybe look else where.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than last year! Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: allesandra
Reviews.Content: I don't have too much to add. The Ritz is still super luxurious. I hadn't thought I'd return again, having been a long time loyal gepuest at Le Bristol, but I just felt that on some level, the Ritz seemed more genuine and took a greater interest in our return visit. Perhaps Le Bristol is reeling from their latest acclaims. But they should beware! The Ritz was genuinely glad to have me back for a second visirpt and prove some of the glitches I encountered first time around were not typical. Although we did not book the extremely expensive Chopin Suite this time, we were treated with great generosity, an exquisite accommodation. I hold one person especially responsible: Monsieur Joerg Boehler, Director of Rooms. True to his word, he did say if we would return to the Ritx he would make our stay perfect. And it was. Thank you Monsieur Boehler. It's not often nowadays that promises and their fulfillment are the same. (see my review of Hotel Imperial Vienna). It was a pleasant surprise and I was glad I had especially avoided the hotels like Plaza Athenee and George V. There is so much more to Paris than Couture shopping. Like a nearly flawless stay at a lovely hotel. And the gifts and amenities in the room show to me, at least, that my stay is truly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “5 star everything!”
Reviews.Author: christina p
Reviews.Content: Everything is a dre. Sty in the Hemingway sweet :-)

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met”
Reviews.Author: sjpoyser
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth weekend at the Ritz, and it's definitely been the best. There were absolutely no hitches in service and it wasn't marred by any aggressive tip-seeking by staff which has occasionally happened in the past. Our package included a very good value 4-hour lesson for two at the Escoffier School, and breakfasts. The American breakfast for two could have fed us for the whole weekend. Wifi was not only free, but you could attach as many devices as you want, which is very rare in my experience. The Christmas decorations were also just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz is worth every euro!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellis3752
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. My mother and I stayed here 25 years ago, and have returned to find it as excellent as we remembered! The furnishings are gorgeous, the service is brilliant, and the restaurant, L'Espadon, well-deserves it Michelin stars! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Putting on The Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: MissBliss2011
Reviews.Content: I took my best friend here for her 30th, we were upgraded to a deluxe junior suite which was amazing, my friend thought I'd organised this but it was a surprise for me also. The room, the view, the service & cocktails were all fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble, I think knowing a little french goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterplus
Reviews.Content: Great service, wonderful food and a charming atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel worth of 100 years of Histories”
Reviews.Author: Whtbox
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is sooo Beautiful inside and outside. The Best is sooo Comfortable and Pillow, everything is good. We arrived, we received a hand written welcome notes and complimentary chocolate and Wine. Breakfast also simply amazing, but it is on the expensive side. Like people said "You paid what you get for". There is one issue that I have prepaid the Hotel through Expedia, but the Hotel still charge me anyway. The issue is sorted when i contacted Expedia and Ritz refunded me the money fast. I'm sorry, But I have to lose the mark for this for a 5-6 star hotel and many celebrities stayed here, this mistake should never ever happen.

Reviews.Title: “Still a classic”
Reviews.Author: glenn3
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 evenings at the Ritz - its everything Cesar would have wanted it to be - many years later. The service and rooms were amazing. We had the Presidential suite and we couldn't of been happier. I went with 3 friends on our 2nd stop through Europe. London was our first...Rome is next. Ate in the world famous resturant L'Espadon. The service and food was great. You have to forget about the price if you go...the wine was unbelievable. Hemingways Bar was terrific with Colin serving up many a great drink. The Hotel is within walking distance of everything. The are closing for 27 months next year as there "stars" went down according to the reviewers. Its a classic...I don't know how they can make it better. Everyone speaks english. The only snobby people we met were on the street...

Reviews.Title: “CLOSING for renovation!!! OH NO...!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisDTW
Reviews.Content: Was just at the Hemingway Bar in Paris this past Saturday night, located in the Ritz Hotel in Paris. My favorite hangout in Paris...and I was informed by the head barman, Colin Field, that the hotel will be closing in 2012 for a two year renovation project. I nearly collapsed!! I've always been welcomed by the staff at the Hemingway Bar, and met the most wonderful people, from celebrities to Prime Ministers to ordinary people. And NOBODY runs a bar better than Colin Fields, and NOBODY mixes drinks and tells stories better than Colin! But, just walking through the lobby and hallways of the Ritz transports you to an age of opulence and decadance....in the classiest way. I can't imagine changes being made, but I hope they don't ruin the hotel and turn it into a theme to compete with the large chain hotels. We shall see!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly know how to make a difference”
Reviews.Author: luganolp
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this property about a year back now and have just got about to review this hotel. On arrival I was hugely excited mainy because I had no idea we would be staying here, At check in which was very early ( about 10) the gentleman said congratulations on your engagment me thinking it was possible my boyfriend trying to get a freebie said nothing, Looking at my boyfriend i could see he was seriously annoyed by this cat of the bag situation and explained he hadnt even asked me yet!!.you can imagine moment over for the proposal...The gentleman apologised perfusly but the damage was now done..we continued to check in and asked what time we could get in the room, He said NOW! you wil not wait! He took us on a tour of the hotel and then showed us to our room...........WOW!! He had upgraded us in a serious way!!! We got the suite in which was bathed in gold and in which Princess Diana and Dodi had stayed just before they past away...the imperial suite it was called an for good reason!!!! You can google this room its on forbes top rooms!!.This room cost €180000 A NIGHT! it was amazing in every way, What a way to say sorry, he then delivered macaroons and champagne on the house to us,he really went way above and beyond the call of duty in making his mistake up to us, The bathroom is simply nothing we will see again,, Huge,galmourous and just excellent. We decided to make the most of the room and ran around the room in our robes whilst people on tour buses took pictures which we could see from the windows that face the very front of the hotel, We over spent on wine and we had the most expensive club sandwich €40 each! but its seriously worth every penny with the service you get. We had a down turn service at around 9.30pm were fresh towels were given. everything tidyied up and made perfect. We also had a meal here and breakfast, For us the service at breakfast is a little stuffy and we would have liked people to be more personalble but we understand that the people who normally go there enjoy this type of service,however you get anything you like.... The meal and food was excellent. If i could ever afford to stay there again i would...If you are looking for a suprise engagment the room that was orginally booked was £1000 for one night but it wil be worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Prepare for a noisy night!”
Reviews.Author: calvhobbes
Reviews.Content: Needless to say, Ritz is one of the top hotels in Paris. The location is really great - its at Place Vendome...Rue de Rivoli is very close by (walking distance)...and so is the Tuileries garden (and subsequently, the Louve and Orangerie museums). I had the opportunity to stay there recently for a couple of days....and was a tad disappointed! Perhaps it was because my expectations were so high....but I really didn't come away with a "wow" experience. We were on a floor that was very, very noisy...even at night. I could see the hotel staff roaming around in their tracks and slippers...so I'm guessing they were housed on the same floor. Unlike most of the other hotels I've stayed in, the rooms do NOT come with the default tea kettle etc., although they did set it up for us when we requested it. But...ask them for tea cups. and 2 reminder phone calls later, they turn up with teenie weenie espresso cups! Overall...a disappointing experience. I'm guessing you have to be really loaded to afford the penthouse here and really get service that lives up to the "Ritz" tag!

Reviews.Title: “Classic style in great location”
Reviews.Author: laoban173
Reviews.Content: lovely old hotel a bit faded ; but nice features in bathrooms, high ceilings and of course a GREAT location Service if you are not a celebrity or speak French can be a bit stiff; i have stayed here three times and it seems like i am still auditioning to be allowed in... Breakfast Extremely expensive---but the Japanese breakfast was up to Tokyo standards according to my guest who lived in Tokyo 1/2 of his life

Reviews.Title: “Was this really The Ritz?”
Reviews.Author: Josie M
Reviews.Content: Clearly this hotel is resting on it's laurels. How disappointing! The Hemingway Bar was dirty. The olive/chips served with the cockstails were obviously recycled from other patrons. Poor service. Inferior wine. Lacking in class completely.

Reviews.Title: “Palatial hotel with very professional staff and an unbeatable location.”
Reviews.Author: WillieVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Ritz, Paris. October 2011 Great location, beautiful building with palatial public areas. It is hard to be unimpressed with this hotel. The restaurants, bars, lobby and pool are luxurious. The staff are very professional, polite, helpful and even quite friendly in a slightly conservative way.  We saw none of the arrogance or pomposity that that we almost expected. The only dreadful displays of self-importance we saw came from a small number of obnoxious guests whom I suspect were overcompensating for their own insecurities. We were there during fashion week which added greatly to the entertainment. There were lots very strange "fashionistas" strutting around in bizarre outfits.  Mostly tall, bulimic, angry looking young women and outrageously effeminate, emaciated (and equally angry looking) young "men".  All seemed extremely self-conscious and mildly contemptuous of "normal" people, they were absolutely hilarious to watch. Now back to the hotel. The regular rooms are not large but are quite adequate and beautifully appointed. The hallways are quite narrow and our elevator was incredibly small, not quite what you expect in a five star hotel. The Bar Vendome is really a restaurant not a bar. It consists of a beautiful, classically French room and an equally beautiful walled courtyard. We would have loved to have eaten in this courtyard but it was the exclusive domain of nicotine addicts who made it uninhabitable for non-smokers. We retreated to the clean but overly warm air of the indoor section. In this city it seems that air-conditioning is rarely used at anything other than its least effective setting. The result is to change the room temperature from unbearable to just mildly uncomfortable. The food and service in Bar Vendome were both superb but be warned, such was not the case in their flagship L' Espadon. My wife and I went there for breakfast with the intention of booking dinner on a later date.  The room is beautiful and the service was excellent but, unfortunately, the food was mediocre and inconsistent. This is supposed to be a Michelin 2 star restaurant but they didn't seem to know how to prepare decent scrambled eggs.  My wife and I both ordered scrambled eggs and sausages. The sausages were poor quality but they were consistent, I am guessing they all came out of the same slightly stale box. My wife's eggs were as good as any fast-food restaurant might provide, but mine were tepid and dry. I suspect they had been sitting under a heat lamp for some time, whereas my wife's had been freshly prepared.  Michelin 2 star? I think not! Despite these minor quibbles we both enjoyed our stay and recommend this hotel for its location, service and excellent amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Ritz 3 star; London Ritz 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer438
Reviews.Content: I am well traveled and have stayed at 5 star hotels in the past. I have three issues/peccadillos about my stay at the Ritz. 1.) ROOM UPGRADE My husband and I booked a room at the Ritz in June 2011 using our AMEX platinum and were "guaranteed" a room upgrade like our stay in London last year where we were upgraded immediately upon arrival. We checked in and the manager 'feverishly' tried to find us an upgrade. "No, we are totally booked." he said. He had brought us to a room overlooking the alley where we could hear and see delivery trucks etc.. It was obvious that this room was a little more worn than others. (This seems to be a recurring theme from previous trip advisor comments.). We went to a cafe for breakfast then returned to the front desk. We spoke to a second shift manager who had absolutely no problem showing us another room. It was on the top floor overlooking a pretty garden with a waterfall. For the remainder of our stay, I had noticed that most of the rooms around us were unoccupied. I am not sure if the 1st manager resents AMEX upgrades, 11year old kids, or was simply unaccommodating...perhaps all three. 2.) ROOM PREPARATION The manager who showed us the room said that they would bring up our luggage from the other room after the final inspection. We came back later in the afternoon and had to call for my daughter's bed to be delivered and made. In London, the bed was made, cookies delivered, and stuffed animal on the pillow. In Paris, the bed was delivered without cookies and void of stuffed animal. At a 4 digit dollar amount each night, they could have spared the added touches. We finally got the bear after asking at check out. One afternoon, about 5ish we returned to our room where a hotel housekeeping supervisor was coincidently leaving our room just as we opened the door. She said she was checking the room to be sure it was acceptable. It seems she needed someone to double check her double checking because the bathroom had no refills of various incidentals and there was no bottled water on the night tables???? What was she checking? 3.) THE CONCIERGE We were lucky to be in Paris when there wasn't a cloud in the sky and the temperature was 80. I had asked the concierge to make reservations at a nice casual cafe with outdoor seating. He sent me to a crowded cafe in a crowded square to a restaurant that served stews. It was 80 degrees....stews at an indoor cafe? I can stand the heat, but stew on a gorgeous night just doesn't seem right. It was the first night so we were exhausted and didn't look for another restaurant. Don't get me wrong, the stew was good..but perhaps on an evening where the temperature is below 75-80 degrees. Toward the end of our trip, I wanted to visit/shop in Marais and asked the concierge for recommendations. He circled a section on the Ritz map which I had shown to the taxi driver. $50 later we ended up at a museum in Marais in the middle of nowhere. I had asked for shops. It was a Sunday, shops aren't open there. The concierge did not circle Les Place de Vosages. What was the concierge thinking and what was I thinking? We then decided to go to the Louvre. In my opinion the Ritz Paris has lost its charm and 5 star service. The Ritz London was hands down a better hotel with better service; no detail unattended. My family and I enjoyed our vacation, but these glitches and sterile service were annoying. .......I know, woe is me.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay but would never!”
Reviews.Author: rb818
Reviews.Content: We stayed a block or two away and decided to go to the Ritz for a drink, and check to see if we would like to stay there on a future trip. We did not walk more then fifteen feet into the hotel when a suited man with an earphone pounced upon us to redirect us out. I don't know why anyone would want to stay at a place that treats people so disrepectfully and rudely. All I can say is that all of the negative reviews have the ring of truth to them. They all say the same thing. The Ritz is an arrogant " crazy actually " place.

Reviews.Title: “1st Wedding Anniversary! WOW”
Reviews.Author: RyanandStav
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise weekend away at the Ritz Paris for my wife and I's first wedding anniversary in September and it is hands down the most amazing hotel in the world. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world but the Ritz Paris is in a league of its own. I informed the hotel before arrival that it was our first wedding anniversary and the service we received was amazing; upgraded to an Imperial Suite overlooking the Vendome, personalised welcome cake in our room, phone calls from the manager to check we was ok, etc. We had some treatments in the spa which were fantastic, the dinner in Bar Vendome was amazing, and drinks on the terrace were great. The staff were the best I have ever experienced. The hotel is expensive but I dont understand people who choose to stay at the Ritz then complain about the price! haha. Thanks The Ritz Paris for a weekend we will always remember. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Added a 3% charge to the room without asking”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurPoirot
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ritz for a few nights for my anniversary a month ago. In general, had a nice stay, though the room was slightly smaller than expected. The concierge was particularly excellent. However, something that I thought was disappointing was the fact that the Ritz tried to charge the room in USD, rather than Euros. This is a common trick that lower-class hotels use to steal a bit of extra money from you, but I was pretty surprised to see the Ritz try to do it. For any US credit card holder, when a hotel tries to charge you in USD rather than Euros, this means "the Ritz tried to charge me a needless additional 3% fee" without asking. (If you read the fine print on the receipt, it even says this.) When I noticed this extra charge and refused, and told the hotel to charge the room in Euros, they did. But, the receipt states that they asked me and I said I wanted to be charged in USD rather than Euros, which is not true. I was fairly surprised to see the Ritz go in for such a petty scam. When you're paying a huge room rate, it's nice to be treated honestly and respectfully at checkout, rather than having the hotel try to add an extra 3% charge because they think you're an idiot.

Reviews.Title: “Extravagant and opulent, but can be noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: raner
Reviews.Content: For the grand finale of a two-week trip to Paris and London we splurged on staying two nights at the Ritz. As expected, the rooms are luxurious beyond imagination and for Paris standards also extremely spacious (the bathroom at the Ritz was larger than the entire room at the other hotel that we patronized on our trip). Parts of the building date back to the 18th century and the interior design goes for a Louis XIV/Louis XV look (not a good choice for travelers who prefer modern interiors, but exactly what you would expect at the Ritz). Great care was taken to blend modern amenities with the traditional styling of the hotel, and even the air conditioning controllers are specially designed to match the look of the original light switches. The only items that stick out a little is the flat -screen TV and the modern clock radio with iPod docking station. The room contains several little electric boxes that can be used to summon the maid, valet, or sommelier (!), or to adjust the lighting or the window shades. Notably, even the bathrooms contain pull cords for calling a maid or valet, so that you can order a snack without leaving the bathtub. We didn't actually try any of those gadgets for calling hotel staff to the room, so we can't really tell for sure whether or not they really worked. One thing that we found a little bit of a turn-off was that you had to walk through a long hallway filled with advertising showcases in order to get to your room. These glass boxes contain products of all luxury brands known to man and may be appealing to the average Ritz customer (the advertising is certainly hitting the right demographic, that's for sure). We found open advertising that is so prominent and in-your-face a little misplaced and annoying. We had previously read some negative comments about the Ritz and other 5-star hotels treating non-jet-set customers in a snooty or arrogant fashion but that was definitely not the case for us. Despite not showing up in a luxury limousine with a bunch of Louis Vuitton luggage in tow we were always treated warmly and respectfully. The lady from the reception was very nice and explained in great detail how to operate the various switches in the room (and there is a lot that needs to be explained). Refreshingly, the Ritz is one of the hotels that still provides excellent concierge service. I've stayed at countless hotels where the concierge was not even familiar with the restaurants in the area or made questionable recommendations or was plainly clueless. The concierge at the Ritz was fun to talk to and helped us a lot in getting around and finding nice dinner places (all in perfect English without being condescending about it). The only flaw with our stay at the Ritz was that there was considerable noise at night. We had rooms on the top floor facing a side street. On top of the ubiquitous noise from Paris mopeds, we could hear a lot of loading/unloading noise, including slamming of doors and frequent operation of hydraulic lifts. We complained the next day and the hotel staff investigated the issue. They found out that on the night in question a big wedding had taken place at an event venue across the street, and they assured us that the problem would not recur. We asked to be moved into different rooms, but this request was declined despite being made in the morning with much time to spare before check-in time. I didn't really understand why we couldn't have switched rooms with some other guests who had not even arrived yet, but maybe that's just the policy at the Ritz. Unfortunately, we were disturbed by similar loading/unloading noise until 3am the next night. Apparently, people were busily setting up yet another event across the street... Well, we did book the lowest room category that was available, and maybe this sort of disturbance just comes with booking the "cheap" rooms at the Ritz. All in all, we did enjoy our stay at the Ritz, but in a hotel in this class it's hard to get your money's worth. There is only one Hotel Ritz Paris, and if you want to say "I've stayed there" you've got to pay the price. Yes, it's maybe a notch more luxurious than a 4-star hotel but it's also slightly over the top (or actually not so slightly, it is just over the top). In the future I will probably settle for 4-star hotels and put the saved money towards another trip. Still, it was a great experience at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but kind of Boring”
Reviews.Author: Z R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz at the end of a month long holiday in Europe, as a treat for our family of 2 adults and 2 young kids. It was truly a classy and highly respectable hotel. The staff were exceptional and treated you like royalty, attending to every possible need. We had to rent 2 connecting rooms, but there was a deal for families that allowed the 2nd room to be half price. Initially, one of the rooms had faulty air conditioning and I called the front desk to complain. After investigation by their technician they determined that it could not be fixed that day and they offered to move us to another floor, which we accepted. The duty manager sent us a bottle of champagne and a letter of apology for the inconvenience, which was very kind and classy. Other hotels would not have taken such action. Unfortunately, the TV set in one of the other new rooms was faulty, but I did not bother to complain, although I am sure that they would have promptly fixed it. I am surprised though that they did not check this (and the air con) ahead of time. Part of the standard checklist at such a high class hotel should be to test the TV, Air conditioner, water taps, windows, curtains, etc. before any room is given to a new guest. Oh well. Other than that, it was a lovely place, however, this kind of high class can become boring after awhile. I personally would not want to stay at the Ritz for longer than a couple of days, even if I was a real millionaire (instead of pretending to be one). The trouble is that there is not really much to do there, after awhile. Its a great place for a 60 yr old, rich, snobbish widow to spend time eating at their expensive restaurant and to go shopping in their long narrow galleria of shops, but younger people will eventually just be yawning after a couple of days. That does not mean that you should not try the place. I think every self respecting human being should stay at least 1 night in the most famous hotel in Europe and to eat at their fantastic, 2 Michelin star restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Paris Landmark...But Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several months ago for the second time, and though this would not be my first hotel of choice in Paris, it is an institution worth trying at least once. As others have said, the hotel has a bit of an attitude, but that is an integral part of what the Ritz is: a classic, relatively formal luxury hotel intended for well-heeled guests with money. Some might consider the hotel stuffy or formal; if so, they would probably be better off at The Four Seasons George V or The Park Hyatt Vendome, hotels with a much more relaxed, contemporary vibe. Location: Though I generally prefer to stay in St. Germain in smaller hotels, I love the Vendome location. The Place Vendome is not only a special little jewel, but the location cannot be beat. For me, the location is one of the best in Paris, and is far superior to the Four Seasons, in particular. Building: The facilities are beautiful, but can seem slightly dowdy or passe when compared to say the Four Seasons or the Meurice, which definitely have more modern touches, and a more up to date feel, both in the common areas and the rooms. My deluxe room was very nice, but again, comparing it to the Meurice or the Four Seasons is a bit like apples and oranges; these hotels are different, though, in general, their rooms are a little more polished and modern. Unique: This is a one of a kind property with a storied history, and walking through those doors every day when returning makes one feel a little special (at least it did me). Service: I find the service to be very good, though it can seem a bit haughty, and is not up to the coddling service of The Four Seasons. What is amazing, however, is that this is such an old-school hotel where everything is done in house, and there are always people to respond to your needs; for example, on my previous stay, I was out quite a bit, often coming home late at night and craving lobster bisque and french fries - something about the elegant room service at two in the morning of a terrine of bisque and french fries was very comforting. The Concierge desk is very good, but I have had superior experiences with both The Meurice and The Four Seasons. Cost: Paris is very expensive. The dollar is weak, so for Americans, Paris is very very expensive. A room at one of the top hotels in Paris is around $1,000/ night, give or take, depending on the season. The incidental costs at these top hotels is through the roof; breakfast is easily $75/person....room service can approach a hundred dollars or more for a burger and a sandwich... a drink can be $30 or $40 dollars. You should not stay at these hotels if you are going to worry about these charges. Part of staying at a special hotel like the Ritz (for me at least), is enjoying a drink at the bar, frivolously ordering a room service snack, or enjoying breakfast in the hotel; if you are going to count every euro spent, I would not recommend staying at the Ritz, or any of its competitors, for that matter. Value is not part of the equation here. For me, there are other hotels in Paris that I prefer, but they are not "better", just different. If you have a chance, you should stay here and taste a bit of history.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT”
Reviews.Author: mbutterfly1977
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris this May and we decided to give this famous hotel a try and we both fell in love starting from the entrance where we were greeted each time we were coming in. It was like in old times – very proper. All restaurants are beautiful with an excellent service and food. Everything you'll read in the guide will come up true and this hotel is exquisite and you need to experience it at least once in your life. There was nothing to complain about. We were simply impressed. Rooms are gorgeous!!!!!! They are so pretty like in a dollhouse. In the huge bathrooms ladies will find excellent cosmetics. I love this hotel and I am sorry I do not love Paris as much as Venice to come here more often.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughts on staying here with two young children.”
Reviews.Author: ewrpex87
Reviews.Content: We were at the Ritz for 5 nights in mid-July booked in a standard King room with an attached Salon. The Salon had a pull-out couch which our two young children used as their bedroom. Let's be honest, if you're considering the Ritz you're not concerned about the cost. Well, maybe a bit concerned, but it's a relative concern. Concerned about getting what you expect for a tidy sum per night, not about the dollars involved and whether you have them. I also presume that Americans may also be interested to know if they will be treated with disdain by the French staff. On the latter question the answer was happily no. Virtually every employee we encountered was exceptional. The few minor problems we had were resolved quickly and requests were met promptly and efficiently. Breakfast at 8 meant exactly 8 sharp. One morning I forgot to ask for toast with our order but it was added anyway as they clearly remembered that I asked for it every other morning. The gentleman that manned the concierge desk in the evening was really a wonderful, pleasant man. My son and I came back from the Bastille Day festivities and he was wearing a French naval hat I purchased for him. I mentioned that I did not realize they would have all these military vehicles at the Opera and I didn't have my camera. The gentleman looked at my son and told him what really matters was the time he spent with his father and that memory will be more important than any picture. It was an incredibly nice thing to say. Sure, there were a few employees that could have been a bit nicer and some that will look in disdain at an American, just because it's the Parisian way. The Ritz has reputation that will not waiver one iota based on what anyone on a message board posts. It is an icon of Paris and rightfully so. If you are heading to Paris with young kids (in my case two grade school aged) and you can swing the cost, you should enjoy the Ritz. The location is fantastic and the hotel has several nice touches the children should appreciate. Food at the hotel is very expensive. If the hotel is a splurge, consider that there are numerous places in Paris to get an outstanding meal for the cost of a room service croque-monsieur. Mind you an exceptional croque-monsieur. Unfortunately, the children's cooking classes ended at the beginning of July, which is the one children's activity we would have liked to sign them up for. The pool is outstanding but as it is a public access healthclub be prepared for looks for those who simply don't want kids there - even in the height of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Yellowlab3944
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to the Coco Chanel suite. Fabulous experience definitely worth the expense. You will lay down the money, ie $70 for 2 coffees and cookies for afternoon in room. Turned out to be a gorgeous tray of petit fours with excellent coffee. Unobtrusive room service made us feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit.”
Reviews.Author: IMAD123
Reviews.Content: Every time we come to Paris we always manage a visit to the ritz. On this occasion the service and atmosphere were both perfect. We especially liked the afternoon tea on the terrace amongst the flowers and fountains. Once more the ritz can hold it's head up high! Can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “best.hotel.ever”
Reviews.Author: earnestsubi
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a lil pricey but you're staying at the Ritz for its history and the experience. Not only are you in the presence of the the ghosts of Hemmingway and Chanel but this hotel has got to have the best.service.ever. I swear they require a minimum of post-graduate education for their concierges. We got a reso at the Eiffel Tower restaurant in a couple hours, which apparently one must book weeks in advance and every other recommendation by its staff has been exceptional. Don't come home drunk and on an empty stomach though cause a kid's burger on their room service menu will run you 50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business (and leisure)”
Reviews.Author: pacificNZ
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Paris is in a great location - very central to everything. The staff are friendly, helpful, and take pride in what they do. I recommend having high tea here too during your stay - it's one of the best I've had!!!

Reviews.Title: “A dream trip”
Reviews.Author: Rutim
Reviews.Content: Booked the Deliciously Ritz package / Deluxe King room on the basis of last year's lunch at L'Espadon which blew us away ! As has been said many times before this is not a hotel for everyone and it is all relatively expensive but we think for what you pay you are getting excellent value for money. This time we enjoyed the same amazing lunch but had amazing weather to boot and managed to sit in the garden for 3 blissful hours. The service and food is first rate and you feel so pampered. It didn't seem to matter that it happened to be Mother's Day in France and so the hotel was much busier, service was just as attentive, in particular we love the sommelier and maitre D' who are so knowledgable and helpful and make the experience effortless helping us chose matched wines, watching our progress and making sure the meal is perfectly paced. We had the joy of being upgraded to a junior suite literally next to the Cesar Ritz suite which meant we had four windows overlooking the obelisk in Place Vendome and whenever we stood near the window tourists took our picture ! Clearly famous folks must get to stay in these rooms.. The suite was beautiful, old school-glamour, not perfect technically but the most adorable finishing - lights, door furniture, switches, mirrors, amazing, I felt like a film star doing my make up in the bathroom ! it is a piece of history to get to stay there and imagine all the people before us who have done so. The high thread count bedlinen and bed were the most comfortable we have ever slept in...I want that linen ! The manager personally enquired if we had enjoyed our stay as we left and we assured him we will return. If you are looking for an unforgettable lunch and hotel overnight you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I tried it but won't do so again”
Reviews.Author: Jafarcakes
Reviews.Content: Spent a short stay in the Ritz en famille - the location in the Place Vendome is quiet and very smart. You are a short walk from the Tuileries and surrounded by luxury brand shopping. Check in is at 3 pm, but we were made to wait until well after that to get our rooms. We did not get the feeling that this mattered very much to the staff. In fact service was generally a bit haughty and not as helpful as you’d expect from a hotel at the real pinnacle of modern hospitality (rather than one living on its reputation). That being said, we were greeted by various managers during or stay with what appeared to be genuine warmth. The hotel is palatial and historic, but has lost its sheen and feels past its best. We had adjoining rooms looking out over the rear of the hotel and the back of the Ministry of Justice – a peaceful view without being spectacular. The rooms were comfortable, bright and well-furnished, though ever-so slightly tired. The ceilings are high and the windows tall but the bathrooms really were nothing special. The bed was very comfortable and covered with gorgeous silky linen. The Ritz is expensive, but it is the Ritz, so no complaints on that score except...the price of breakfast. Yes, it is taken in the glorious dining room and the cornflakes are nice - but $100 per person?! Can’t comment on lunch/dinner because we did not take any other meals in the hotel, partly because two boisterous young children just did not fit with the rather hushed ambience. They have a good pool in the basement. No real complaints, and I’m happy to have tried this legendary hotel, but beyond the history, the Ritz has nothing special to recommend it. Next time we’re in Paris, we will choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What an improvement”
Reviews.Author: JNiedrau
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Ritz in various occasions over the past years and I have always enjoyed the extravagant atmosphere. But this time I was amazed by the service and their attention to detail. I was told it is under new management. We had one of our best dining experiences in France in their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: wms090359
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed in a finer hotel. The service, rooms, everything was perfect. Pricey but worth every cent to be treated like royalty!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller10169
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from 3 nights at the Ritz Paris. Our stay was amazing and I cannot fault anything about this hotel. The location was fantastic, breakfast was divine and the service from all the staff was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A waste of time and money”
Reviews.Author: WorldChris
Reviews.Content: I was kind of excited about my first and only stay at the Ritz. The room was old and stuffy, which wasn't a total surprise, but the service was lacking, which was a surprise. We had a problem with our room and called down to the front desk. They said someone would be up to fix the issue - but two hours later - we had to call again and talk to a manager. Who really didn't seem to care, not a big issue except for the $700 price tag.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: tommy037
Reviews.Content: first class overall. The real testaurang, Espar`gong, Thank you exellent food en service. You have do this in a livefime, thankyou,

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but nice”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Speed
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels stayed. Hotel was quite old but still retained the old world charm. Pricey for what it is but service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “exclusive luxury”
Reviews.Author: cbreezedad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times. We also love the George V and the Meurice but this one is the best. Whereas the Meurice has a beautiful restaurant, nice views and the bathroom in the 3d floor suites is over the top, it has too many business travelers and is too crowded. The George V has the friendliest staff, great views of the Eiffel Tower and wonderful suites but is at a poor location. The Ritz is the best. It is exclusive. It has a great location. The suites and rooms are elegant, comfortable and gorgeous decorated in classic Louis XIV French styling and colors. The pool is wonderful. And the restaurant is the best. I have had the finest croissants, orange juice, hot chocolate and dessert I have ever eaten in this restaurant. The staff is incredibly accomodating. In the bar restaurant I had the best hamburger I have ever eaten- it was 64 euros but hey, it included fries. The Hemingway bar is a kick. The concierge staff has done everything from booking the best restaurants, to getting me needed medicine to fixing a pair of expensive shoes. The only negative is there are no views as compared with the other top hotels.

Reviews.Title: “an elegant experience”
Reviews.Author: strulovitz
Reviews.Content: my wife was celabrating her 60 birthday in paris. i read many different reviews about the hotel and i was a bit worried. i am happy to report it was an elegant and very pleasant experience from the moment we left our rented car to the hotel staff until we got it back. the check in process was short and easy. our room was elegant and very pleasant. we enjoyed very much the breakfast and the lunch at the elegant l'espadon hotel restaurant. the staff was very professional and friendly. it was a rewarding experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: pabel1
Reviews.Content: You can travel the world and still there is only one Ritz Paris! We also enjoyed the bar downstairs for a quiet drink and enjoyed our time there too. If you have not heard this bar is one of the old hideaway for the 'Lost Generation' and still has a wonderful charm.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Glows”
Reviews.Author: dknlin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day trip to Paris with my partner. We stayed at the Ritz for 3 nights and the Plaza Athenee for 2 nights. Without any question the Ritz was the superior experience. In addition, I travel to Paris often and within the past two years have stayed at Four Seasons George V, Le Meurice, the Ritz, and Plaza Athenee. Again without any question the Ritz was the best experience. I last stayed at the Ritz ten years ago and it was good then. But everything about the hotel has improved, especially the service. At check in our room was not ready but the very friendly front desk staff sent us down to the spa and pool area. She asked us what we needed from our luggage and then carried some of our belongings herself! For those who have stayed at the Ritz before you know that they have one of most beautiful indoor poor and spa in the world. My partner and I got to relax in the pool, jacuzzi, sauna; we even took a nap by the pool. And we spotted a famous French actress/model swimming in the pool, clearly a part of her noon exercise routine. When we checked into our room we were upgraded to one with a sweeping view of Paris including the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides. And the room's bathroom came with a jacuzzi tub and sauna! A first in my extensive travel around the world. We also had dinner at L'Espadon and found it to be a truly wonderful experience. The food was great and the wait staff very friendly. My partner does not speak any French but the staff was just as courteous and warm. We also had dinner at Alain Ducasse au Plaza Athenee and the restaurant at Le Meurice during this trip but liked L'Espadon the best. And just as before I love the peach-colored towels (and more number and kinds of towels than any hotel!) at the Ritz. Really makes one feel being enveloped in warmth and luxury in the bathroom. And they upgraded to la Prairie bath products which are excellent. And one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in, much better than the one at the Plaza Athenee. Also whenever we ordered room service the food was delivered quickly and seamlessly. What had always distinguished the Ritz is a sense of history, luxury, discretion. During this last stay it's clear to me the service has also improved to the level of the best Four Seasons hotels in the world. It's definitely my favorite hotel in Paris now and is where I'll stay next time I travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz more in name than substance”
Reviews.Author: Johnb8
Reviews.Content: This place is not CLOSE to the level of luxury that you may have found at the Ritz in London if you stayed there and were expecting a similar experience in Paris. I get the sense that they are living off the Ritz name, while not really offering the full Ritz experience. The rooms are more tired than luxurious......not a PATCH on the quality of the London Ritz's rooms, despite costing a lot more. The service is fine, and i must say that I encountered none of the bad service others have mentioned here. But two things irritated me following my three day stay: 1) The rooms.....with their slightly worn out carpets, old bathrooms with blemishes in the workmanship fully on display.....simply not 5 star rooms. 2) The prices. Ok, you could say "You stayed at the Ritz...you can't complain about prices", to which I would say "Why NOT?". Just because it is named "Ritz"....does that mean they can charge ANY price they like? Like $40 for a drink in the bar? Like $12 for a can of coke in the mini bar......or $12 for a tiny can of Pringles in the mini bar? Or maybe $60 for a room service burger, or $70 for a cheese pizza? I got the sense that, more than any other hotel I can remember patronising, that these guys are REALLY after your wallet....and are determined to empty no matter what. The lobby areas are quirky, long tube-like spaces with no central grand lobby area. There is a 300 foot walk (if not a bit more, in fact) down a seemingly endless passageway lined with merchandise for sale in order to get to your room. Somewhat tacky, to my taste. Considering that they charge as much as the George V, I struggle to see why anyone would stay here. And if you DO for some reason stay here, do NOT fall for their trap of picking you up or dropping you at the airport. They charge $350 for this (each way), and any other limo company in town will do it for $150 in the same, or nicer car. As I said, the main impression one leaves with is that the primary theme here is to get as much money out of you as possible. If they lowered the price of everything 50% in the hotel, bars and restaurants you would just about be getting good value. I stay at the London Ritz a lot, and have never left there thinking I'd been ripped off. it's expensive, but worth every penny. The Paris Ritz is merely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Newton A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Ritz Paris to celebrate our marriage anniversary. It was marvelous, a dream realization. Everything at Ritz is very personalized, since your arrival till your leaving. Most comfortable bed we’ve ever slept on. Swimming pool by itself is a tourist place to visit, totally made in Venetian mosaic. If you have the chance to stay there someday, you do not need to visit Versailles while in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Did not find the staff rude? Great stay! A little”
Reviews.Author: lvnluxury
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay immensely. The outstanding service began when we drove up to the doors. The bell captain asked whether or not he should park our car, to which I told him we needed to return it to the rental company. He said "no problem, I will see to it that the car is returned". The suite was very nice and exactly what I expected from The Ritz Paris. Any and all contact with the staff was very cordial and efficient. The concierge desk was very helpful with hard to get reservations and the hotel car was available to take us to dinner. The Maitre d’ for breakfast was very hospitable and had memorized the football stats from the day before. Go Packers! However, there were a couple of things that struck me as unnecessary! When paying over $1700 per night for a room, you would think that a couple of small things would be included. In order to connect to wifi, there was an extra $25 per day charge. The next shocker was a charge of $90 to press two shirts. This is no big deal, I just felt "nickel and dimed". I would gladly have paid an extra hundred a day for the room and have these things included. All in all, The Ritz is a fantastic house and I will stay there again in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, rooms a little tired...”
Reviews.Author: smast
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, rooms a little tired though could do with a refurb but the main areas were impressive and service of a truly 5 star service,

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Paris not worth your time or money”
Reviews.Author: jj98004
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz Paris in July 2010. The hotel is nice but a bit tired in appearance - older furniture, smaller bathrooms (tub only) and squeaky floors. Service is slow. Staff is nice and polite but not particularly helpful relative to other 5 star hotels such as the Parky Hyatt Vendome or the Four Seasons George V. Also, be aware of mini bar charges. We were charged for a watch that is in the mini bar (USD240). I know this sounds bizarre but apparently the hotel Ritz puts a watch in their hotel mini bars for sale. The charge was made 2 days after we checked out. Needless to say, this charge is in dispute. Just be careful about mini bar charges and check it with the front desk at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Ajb1207
Reviews.Content: I was very lucky to be able to stay at the Ritz in the stunning location of Vendome Place for 2 nights in September 2011. I have read reviews with interest saying the staff were snobs. Personally speaking I couldnt fnd any faults with any of the staff I came across from the excellent door staff to the service maids. They were all very polite and always had a smile on their faces. All I would say is if you ever get chance to stay here, do yourself a favour and grab that opportunity with both hands!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suite, mixed service, gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: allesandra
Reviews.Content: I almost always stay at Hotel le Bristol. I wanted to try another Paris hotel for a change. Stayed at the George Cinq Four Seaons once, and wasn't really impressed; (had lunch there this time and I was really glad I hadn't chosen to stay there...I think I have overdosed on the ubiquitous FS brand -Im just over it and overdosed on it). The Ritz Paris: I was a little trepidatious because it is a "tourist attraction." Sightseeing buses and folks laden with cameras all come to look at the Ritz:: at least as much because of Princess Diana as well as being one of the most "famous" hotels in the world. Sometimes "famous hotels" can be tourist traps, so I was a little worried. The security at the hotel is fabulous; the doormen and "plain clothes" security men ensure that tourtists are not in the lobby to gawk and give the place a "once-over", impeding the privacy and enjoyment of the hotel guests. Upon check-in, we were whisked to our beautiful suite, and we found a bottle of Champagne, a bowl of fruit, chocolates and a huge flower arrangement of white roses. The check-in formalities were done in the room: no standing at the desk at reception after a long, over night flight from the U.S. We specifically booked the Chopin Suite. It is stunning. All the panelling and highly decorated ceiling, with gilt and mouldings and panelling, fireplace, and parquet floors are original. Chopin's last dwelling was across the Place Vendome and this suite was created in his honor.The furniture, draperies, bedding, parquetry floors and period-accurate accoutrements enhnaced the beauty of the suite. Although not enormous, the suite had a lovely entry hall, which had a door which closed off theliving area completely from the front door. This was great: when we ordered room service, the waiter used his pass key to leave the table in the entry foyer while our privacy was undisturbed. The living room was lovely with brand new upholstery; everything in great condition. Off the living room, there was a huge bathroom: all black and white marble, and elaborate bronze taps on all the sinks...shaped like swans.....a tad over the top, but fun, for it really helped to keep up the fantasy of actually living in the period of the decor. The original panelling concealed closets. Even light switches were "banned" from the room. What looked like large brass keys controlled the lighting. The lighting was ample and there were dimmers on all the chandeliers and sconces as well as any lamps. The bedroom, which is the heart of the Chopin Suite, is a hexagonal-shaped room. With splendid period furniture and the most magnficent ceiling and marble fireplace, I felt lucky indeed. The huge French Door/window overlooked the Place Vendome. It was fun to step out on our balcony and drink in the atmosphere of this iconic Parisian spot. There was a second, full bath, gorgously done with every amenity imagineable. The room service food was a let=down, and the service from the concierge was spotty. For a hotel of this calibre it seeemed odd that the concierge was not really on top of things; they did not have a "we can do anything" attitude...which I thought was a major flaw. By the way, the hotel was absolutely empty....although this is not necessarily the fault of the hotel...the ghost-town quality of the hotel was a little bit of a turn-off. I had no desire to go the bar or have a relaxing meal in any of the dining venues because I felt we would be dining alone. All in all, I nice stay. I don't think I would go back to this hotel. The location is not my favorite. I prefer the location of the Bristol, the George V and even The Crillion (on the stupendous Place de Coooncorde) seems a little closer to where I like to be in Paris. The Ritz is located in what was formerly the best part of town. but like in most cities, the best, or most exciting, parts of town shift over time. Also, The Rtz seemed harder to get to the left bank and it was quite far from the Eiffel Tower. All in all, though a nice stay ibn a beautiful, unique suite. As a music lover and pianist, I just wanted to stay in the Copin Suite. I was glad I had the chance, but now I will o back to my real "home in Paris," Le Bristol, which always seems to work best for me.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz hotel Paris: Luxury redefined”
Reviews.Author: ChiragPune
Reviews.Content: Well Paris is generally considered as the hottest tourist spot in world. So I was excited to visit the place for the first time. Apart from the glamour and elegance offered by the beautiful city, I was looking for a quality accommodation. And as suggested by a friend, I decided to book into one of Paris's grandest hotels: the Ritz Hotel. From day one I realized why it was called one of the finest places in world. The hotel has all the finest world class amenities exuding elegance, glamour and luxury. They include cable TV, Wi Fi access, CD players and AC for using during the summer. All the rooms have a mini bar and a safe. Ritz offers rooms of different size and what is unique is that these rooms are decorated with varying structural designs. This gives a different ambiance to all types of visitors. The hotel has a total of 103 rooms overlooking gardens and city rooftops. I also enjoyed the free access to the hotel's health club armed with the fitness center and a pool. There is so much more to the Ritz Paris that cannot be put into words. You will know the meaning of luxury just as I did in my stay at the Ritz. The only thing to worry about for me was that it was setting my pocket back quite a bit but then it was one great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's good reputation should not make staff being snob”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ritz about a year ago. The rooms were really nice and spacious, as you would expect from a hotel charging you 400EUR per night. However, I found the receptionists and the staff a bit snob. OK I got it guys.... You work in one of Paris' Creme de la Creme hotels but take it easy... You should make the customer feel like home, non? Breakfast was ok, simple and elegant. Overall, I would definitely recommend it but in my personal opinion, if you really want to spend that much money for a stay in Paris, you'd better spend it for De Crillon or Plaza Athenee.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby reception, made us feel $800 a night entilited us to the garret.”
Reviews.Author: almster
Reviews.Content: The welcome we received was chilly at best. I asked for a beautiful room, and his reply was "well, Madame, at that price, you will only receive our basic room" "So, i am not going to receive a nice room?" "well of course, all the rooms at the Ritz are nice..." I was so shocked at his attidude. I usually stay at the George V, where they are so warm and friendly. They also questioned my husband several times to show his room key when he entered the hotel, which has never happened at ANY 5 star hotel we have EVER stayed in. They need to understand that many computer geeks wearing casual clothes and big tennis shoes can be and are successful and prosperous. Very INSULTING attidude. I have already recommended to several clients to never stay at the Ritz when they go to Paris. The Ritz made us feel like we were paupers and cheap to only spend $800 dollars a night, made us wait 2 hours for our room, top floor garrett room at the very back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: Paris has many deluxe properties, Mandarin Oriental are in the process of creating yet another one to add to the list which broadly speaking could be split into two categories, the historic palaces and the shiny & new, The Ritz firmly heads up the former. From the outside The Ritz is a revolving door and a few white awnings, once inside the sheer scale of the place is impressive; a real tardis effect. It is a very discreet hotel, the sort of place one cannot really look into, it is certainly not a property one wanders through on a whim; I observed several tourists attempting this and they were all prompty bounced out. To address some of the previous "reviews" regarding entry being refused, The RItz is a world of its own, the moment it lets everyone enter this world, this world is no more. Check-in was very efficient; in fact all the staff were not only courteous but also extremely friendly and helpful. My luggage comprised a couple of delicate items (glass) I had bought that day at the shops, and they were relatively unwrapped in a shopping bag; when my luggage was brought to the room they had been wrapped in bubble-wrap, just one example of the exceptional service one can enjoy at this property. The rooms will not be to everyone's tastes. If you like everything to have a brand new, creak-free feel to it you won't be impressed with the bedrooms here, the bathrooms even less so. This is in fact what I found most charming about the bedrooms, besides a new television and other modern technologies they remain pretty much unchanged for decades and decades, and have a timeless elegance and opulence about them. Decor is classic "palace style", and everything was absolutely immaculate. The bathroom could've been straight out of the thirties, elegant white marble, a vast cast iron bath-tub, twin pedestal basins with taps formed as swans, all decked out with their signature peach towels. My only gripe was that the bath took nearly half an hour to fill as the hot water pressure was pitiful. However, the charm virtually nullified this minor inconvenience. The spa area is an impressive size, especially for a Parisian hotel. A particularly homely touch is that one can wander down (via a direct lift) in their bathrobe. There is a pool area and separate mens/womens jacuzzi, sauna and steam room area. Around the pool are loungers and one or two "bed" type arrangements for couples. Whilst these facilities were a pleasure to use and the staff excellent, they do feel somewhat dated compared to more modern spas - the sauna is just a sauna, not one of those pearlescent tiled ones where water trickles through various scent phases etc. This is certainly an area which could be improved upon in terms of what is on offer, but what is currently offered is high quality and certainly provides a pleasant respite from the busy city. Also available within the hotel are numerous bars, the famed L'Espadon, and a shopping gallery (which must be several hundred feet long). Even breakfast was served with finesse and elegance; the a la carte menu offers some delicious dishes, all typically classical in their nature. The Hemingway Bar provides a pleasant juxtaposition to the opulent grandeur of the rest of the property, it is a small wood panelled room with various photographs and mementos from Hemingway, with a clubby feel. It reminded me of the bar at The Connaught, London prior to its identikit renovation. Value for money is something that one shouldn't really attempt to categorise when staying at The Ritz. The staff are all so helpful, pleasant and charming, the rooms so comfortable that one really does feel at home there, relaxed with virtually every whim catered for. Needless to say, nothing is cheap there. A couple can easily rack up a EUR500 room service bill on a couple of dishes (not even caviar or truffles) and a bottle of "cheap" wine e.g. a pizza is EUR50. One does not go to The Ritz and expect economy. One thing that irritated me slightly was not being open about charging for extras, EUR50 for a pizza is fine, the price is stated... I asked housekeeping for a couple of toothbrushes and paste (a very standard request in any hotel) which were very promptly delivered in a Ritz carrier bag. I thought nothing more of this until I came to check-out and had been billed for them; not cost price, but probably something approaching 12 times cost. Firstly, no hotel I have ever stayed at charges for a dental kit (admittedly these were full size tubes of toothpaste and "normal" toothbrushes, but one would and should only expect the best at The RItz) and secondly, it would have been courtesy to have left a receipt for this in the bag; all things considered, this is a petty gripe in the grand scheme of things. If you are the sort of traveller who seeks to experience an era of grand travel and elegance that is no longer widely prevalent then The Ritz is definitely the place where you can indulge yourself. It has immense character and oozes charm from its beautifully elegant rooms to its numerous terraces and gardens; walking out of its revolving door back into Place Vendome one really does pass from one world into another!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TomD515
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our Anniversary and her birthday at the Ritz. The hotel and its staff went out of their way to make sure it was a memorable experience. We received a cake in our room for our Anniversary and my wife received a cake for her birthday. The staff could not have been friendlier, more attentive and wonderful. This is truly one of a handful of great hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is definitely Ritzy....”
Reviews.Author: PalmSpringsDiva*
Reviews.Content: Knowing I was a little weary of traveling food, the chef at the Ritz asked me what I would like and then cooked me "midwestern" food with this yummy interpretation. What a great dinner that was!

Reviews.Title: “Historical Glamour now History”
Reviews.Author: VoxVolpe
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is a classic that has an amazing history, visited by characters such as Coco Chanel to Hemingway, but sadly that glamour and reputation are no longer deserved. It is not that the Ritz is terrible, though I would say the 70's bathrooms with faux marble are indeed terrible, it just pales now compared to the other grande dames of Paris. Praise is deserved for the overall service minus the concierge, and the new outside bar is contemporary and a nice respite from the hectic pace one lives in Paris. The bed was comfortable and breakfast in our room was lovely. The area is superb and though I think the interior is dated it is nice. The Hemingway bar is a must and it does have great historical significance. On the negative the concierges were both short and one restaurant recommendation was positively atrocious. The room was dated and yes again the bathrooms are beyond dated. Check in was shoddy and slow and overall feel was not a value especially again compared with it's peers. Final recommend is to skip the Ritz, stay at one of the other grand hotels of Paris and simply visit the Hemingway bar to wallow in the history.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Cosima123
Reviews.Content: A dream hotel! The pool is heavenly, the service at breakfast is divine. The little oval elevator in the back epitomizes the old world charm that this hotel exemplifies. The service was lovely. My daughter lost her favorite blanket and the staff searched for it and made us feel like it was a top priority. When they could not locate it, the manager came to our breakfast table and presented her with a watch. Later, they found the blanket and it was carefully laid out (they did not ask for the watch back). I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous service”
Reviews.Author: Peef
