Reviews.Content: My husband booked a weekend stay at this apparently fabulous hotel as a birthday treat for me. He decided to book for the Valentines weekend. He had problems booking direct with the hotel initially and eventually had to use an agent. As the date got closer he telephoned the hotel to enquire about certain arrangements and was assured all was in hand, he also mentioned that he assumed that as per their own website as it was Valentines weekend we would as a matter of course received the 'little extras' mentioned. He was told in no uncertain terms that no we wouldn't as there was no availability left. He questioned this as he had booked a while earlier but the staff were un friendlt and unbending. Hmmm...... should have seen the signs. Perhaps it was because we have not booked direct? But that was because he couldn't! On arrival, check-in was no problem, and we were shown to our room. As we looked out of the window to see the view of the garden we had been assured of, we looked out onto a road. My husband didn't want to make a fuss and spoil the weekend so mentioned our disappointment when we went out. Next morning we went down for breakfast to see a number of different couples, families milling around the entrance to the L'Espadon restaurant. When we spoke to the lady at the entrance to the restaurant we were told very firmly that there was no availability in the restaurant. No apology, no alternative, we got the distinct impression that she would rather like us to not want breakfast and to just go away. My husband spoke to reception who arranged for a side room to be opened and and a 'sort of 'breakfast service was offered to us and others who were waiting. It was not nearly the same standard and my husband explained that we were unhappy and could we be guaranteed a table in L'Espadon the next morning. After all this is The Ritz and L'Espadon is special and is what is expected when you are paying for breakfast. We were told we would have a table and asked what time we would like it for we said between 9.45 and 10.00 am. Fine, booked. We got down to breakfast and just gone 9.45 am and were informed that as we hadn't arrived'on time' there was no table. At this stage my husband is really seeing red. He explained that we had left the time a little flexible for their benefit and that we DID expect them to allocate the next table free to us. Eventually we had breakfast in the beautiful room. As a gesture of apology we were offered a late 'check-out'. Which was much appreciated as we were booked in for afternoon teat in the hotel and we did not have then to lave our bags with concierge and could change before we headed off for the airport. However, whilst we were having afternoon tea, we were approached by a member of staff who questioned why our belongings were still in our room - we fels as though we were being accused of almost trying to squat there and refusing to leave! We explained that we had been given a late check-out and this was accepted. However my husband was seething as our afternoon tea was ruined, we felt rushed then and so quickly finished what should have been an enjoyable end to our stay and went back to our room to get our bags. No sooner had we closed the door to the room than it was being banged quite abruptly. On answering my husband was questioned by the housekeeper as to when we would be leaving and standing just behind here was a gentleman in a suit, obviously there as back up just in case we were refusing to leave, we can only assume! This action was totally unnecessary, so totally over the top and so wrong. We were not overstaying at all, it was till only early afternoon and we had been offered the late check-out by reception, by way of apology. We explained our extreme upset at our treatment and went through the eents at reception. They obviously apolgised and said that they would investigate to see what had gone wrong. To this day, we have still not had a written communication from the hotel, let alone any form of compensation for such a totally ruined stay. We stayed here because we have previously stayed at The Ritz in Madrid - what a difference. That hotel is superb, fantastic and the staff are wonderful. Nothing too heavy just professional and good! Paris was not even close to Madrid so if you're just looking for a lovely weekend stay go to Madrid instead. If you need to got to Paris, book anywhere else instead. Obviously if you are not a regular affluent client or celebrity the service is just not there.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: houseofb
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is first class all the way. The red carpet treatment started at the airport where a hotel employee greated us on the ramp of the airplane. Yes, literally on the ramp. He took our passports and said, "Follow me". He ushered us to a private passport agent. We could hear people saying, "Who are they". Our luggage didn't arrive and our personal assistant was on it. We arrived at the hotel and check in already knew our luggage was missing. They asked what we needed to get by until it showed up. I had enough for one night, so I was all set. My husband had nothing. They got his size and preferences for toilettries and within 30 minutes returned with Dolce and Gabana clothes, Hermes cologne, and other items! We've never experienced such service. They couldn't do enough to make us comfortable. Our luggage, which was expected to arrive the next day, arrived at 11pm that evening. Our room was luxurious, clean, and amenities plentiful. Each day we walked into a little treat in our room. Champagne, fruit, finger foods, snacks, etc... Our stay was during New Year's and when we returned to our room after our evening out, a huge basket of full size spa products, wrapped in cellophane with a bow, was on our bed. Needles to say, our needs were anticipated as soon as we arrived. Reservations were made promptly, car service available at any hour, etc...Restaurants are absolutely fabulous. Expensive and worth it. After all, this is one of the nicest hotels in the world and it's Paris. This is not a place to go to watch your pennies or find a bargain. Be prepared to spend and enjoy doing it. Our departure also consisted of a personal assistant, who expedited the check in process and escorted us to a private lounge, while we waited for our flight. This is the life celebrities lead and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your designer duds.”
Reviews.Author: SjaakLondon
Reviews.Content: I had a similar experience as one of the other reviewers. The doorman asked me what I was looking for and when I answered that we wanted to have a drink in the bar, he said the bar was full and you need a reservation. My friends, who wear wearing Burberry and Mulberry then tried and weren't asked anything. So ditch the Gap bag and bring your Gucci if you want to have a drink here...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the myth”
Reviews.Author: hgeslin
Reviews.Content: Ritz is a legendary palace and staying there is always a nice experience. You will get what you are expecting: excellent service, nice room, great food. Decoration is very traditional but not dated. I am not a big fan but they manage to integrate all modern amenities without compromising on the decoration so it’s very harmonious. If you are lucky and wealthy you will get a room with view on Place Vendome and get the full experience. The room service is excellent, delivering fresh and high quality food. Try the swimming pool in the morning and you won’t be disappointed!! The opulent style is quite unique! Try the legend once in your life!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: visitorLeics
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many 5 star hotels in Europe and indeed in Paris as this was our 10th visit. The Ritz was the worst in all our experiences which ranged from small boutique hotels like Le Tremoille (fantastic for romance) to the George V (what a welcome!). And now to the Ritz. The welcome at Reception was luke warm at best. Later when i collected the key to the room i was shown up by an extremely icy receptionist to room (141) reached by an extremely narrow corridor where two people could not pass. No features of the room were shown, the receptionist merely turned on her heels and left. The room was old grandeur not a bad size (had bigger for the price). Great bath tub, rubbish shower, lots of fluffy towels bathrobes and slippers. The lights fused but this was sorted out quickly. Had an early room service breakfast in the morning as leaving for the airport this was delivered by two extremely friendly gentlemen, who did make us feel like guests. Checkout fast and efficient. All i can say is that i would never stay here again and only recommend it to people who drive lambourghinis or ferraris or arrive from the airport via chauffeured limousine.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Snobs - Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: holaanna
Reviews.Content: I had been reading Hemingway and wanted to try the bar at the Rtiz Hotel. We had on tennis shoes and casual dress. The doorman chased us out of the hotel.... said their was a delegation in town. We explained we wanted to patronize the bar - but he would have none of it. After us, two elderly ladies in gucci and channel walked right in. We spend many afternoons at the Ritz in Laguna Niguel, Ca and never got this rude behavior. Only rude french people on entire trip!

Reviews.Title: “Go on...treat yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Urban3000
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's an expensive hotel. No it's not great value. But you feel good staying here and being treated well. From our pickup at Gare du Nord we knew this would be a special stay. We had a lovely suite and enjoyed extras that were included in the our package. We loved the summer terrace bar - fantastic cocktails. The hotel is stunning, the staff are professional and it's easy to cocoon yourself and enjoy its pleasures.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and chic typical parisienne”
Reviews.Author: Mirbog
Reviews.Content: Was at the Ritz with my husband last week. Before booking was deciding between Hotel Ritz and Le Crillon, but we made the best joice as Place Vendome is very tranquil compared to Place Concorde and rue rivoli. I booked an executive room through LHW and we were given Ernest Hemmingway suite. Very spacious, beautiful and comfortable . Welcome treat - Ritz Champagne and cheese platter. Nice bathroom with 2 sinks . Also good food.(though a bit expensive) Nice lunch or dinner outside-entrance through Bar Vendome. Very good service. I found the corridors and lifts a bit confusing. The hotel has long beautiful corridor. Nice spa and beautiful pool. Where breakfast is served is just superb, so elegant beautiful. Only i prefer less formal breakfast or perhaps a buffet one. All in all it's sure above average. Those who appreciate elegance, will love the Ritz hotel, business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Service as it should be”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: Having stayed just prior in the Berkely in London, which has no native English people inside the hotel, it was a delight to stay here. Entirely French staffed - immaculate manners and a real passion for service. The more I travel the more I realize the hardware is almost irrelevant - it's the staff that matter. A colleague made a point of sitting down for breakfast just to experience the service.! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for the name”
Reviews.Author: ALISTER54
Reviews.Content: There are so many better hotels in Paris. My room at the Ritz was ok, the breakfast was poor, Hemmingway`s is a tourist haunt and overpriced and overall a very average experience. Try the Four Seasons George v hotel and you will understand my views.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: TravelcatLondon
Reviews.Content: I spent the May half term holiday at the Ritz with my husband and two children (11 and 8) and had a wonderful time. Having stayed there on business several years ago, I arrived with high expectations. The service was impeccable, the staff immaculately smart and polite. We had a double room inter-connecting with our children's twin-bedded room, situated at the side of the hotel on the 1st floor. We decided upon the Ritz because it has a good-sized (for Paris) swimming pool and is well-located. Highlights: breakfast, dinner, concierge service, mattress, bedlinen, gym, pool, spa Could be improved: bathrooms, re-stocking of mini bar Price alert: Babysitting service Euros 50 per hour!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Bar for Hemmingway Fans”
Reviews.Author: kitkatgates
Reviews.Content: I deliberately went to the Hemmingway Bar at the Ritz because I happened to be in Paris on business. I guess many of the other patrons went at busy times. We Americans were cordially shown around the place and thoroughly indulged with drinks and tall tales. Also, if there is ever a prize for lovliest ladies room, the Ritz Bar should get it.

Reviews.Title: “Bar Hemmingway”
Reviews.Author: Glengarrif
Reviews.Content: We spent an evening in Bar Hemmingway two nights ago, during our stay. Our stay was average, not what one expects from the Hotel Ritz, however the evening in the Bar was most surprising for the supposed quality of this hotel. We expected a night to remember in what is a very famous bar in Europe. The bar was full of insolent tourists, noisy, inappropriately dressed and taking up many tables so that some people were turned away. Barmen 'pushing' the Serendipity cocktail, followed by the 'Bomb' cocktail, reiterated their tired reportaire to each person who entered. Overkill on the Hemmingway theme, was off putting and rather trashy. The Bar is very very small, so that one can hear everything, especially the conversations of the bar people. Service was slow. Drinks overly expensive. There was one french barperson/waiter (?) who was very attentive and kept filling the delicious home baked crisps and olives, but apart from that, we were disappointed. When a drunk person entered, was greated by the staff as if he was known by them favourably, and proceeded to be a nuisance, we realised that the notion of the Ritz was a myth.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: KarenAlice
Reviews.Content: Immpecable service, professional yet warm. My husband organised our trip as a surprise for my 40th and I couldn't have wished anything better. The experience exceeded both our expectations. The staff, especially in the restuarant at breakfast time, were superb and made our stay extra special. A real delight, we won't be waiting for the next big birthday as a reason to go to The Ritz Paris, we've already decided we'll back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A monument that needs modernism”
Reviews.Author: ElijahBaley
Reviews.Content: Having been living in Paris during the first 20 years of my life, the Ritz represents for me (and I am sure for a lot of people) a monument of the Parisian hospitality and I had the chance to finally experience it from inside. Unfortunately it left me a disappointing aftertaste: is the hotel really on the average side or is its style just not meant for me. There is nothing to say on the location. It is (nearly) in the centre of Paris with most of the touristic attractions and luxury boutiques at hand. And the Place Vendome is not as noisy as the nearby rue de Rivoli. The overall design is typically classic French with heavy decoration. This point is totally subjective to individual sensibility but if you are into modern hotels with contemporary concepts like in Asia where luxury properties hire worldwide famous design firms, then you should look elsewhere. The rooms are of average size with no unique features. The bathroom is however quite spacious. The service is technically spotless but it seriously lacks spontaneity and warmth. We also encountered an inconvenience as we were given a room with two beds that were made as one. We asked the guest relation to separate them as soon as we entered the room but we are still waiting for it...

Reviews.Title: “In one word: SUPERBE!”
Reviews.Author: mimi0067
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz a couple a years ago (2007) for 4 days and beacuse of all the other comments I really felt writing a different review. This hotel is elegant and chic. The staff from concierge to restaurant, to pool, to the Hemingway bar were all very very friendly!! i've stayed at the Ritz in Madrid as well which was nice too but the Ritz in Paris is something different. I would recommend it! As people are writing some negative rubbish about the hotel staff, some hotel guests have lack of manners and feel they own the world. I was really disgusted by the fact that at breakfast a young couple entered the restaurant bare foot!! What an insult to the other guests and staff!! Also loud talking, and very obnocious behaviour of some (I'm very sorry to say) American guests that demand the world really has to be said. The staff remained friendly as they should, but for some guests that is just not good enough! So ignore all the negative rubbish, stay at the ritz, enjoy Collin Field's cocktail, absord the elegance and most of all: enjoy Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Francophile1043
Reviews.Content: We have just got back home after spending four nights at the Ritz and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The welcome was friendly, the service was excellent, the room was fantastic (we were upgraded on arrival), the food in the restaurant was superb and our stay was a memorable one. Don't take any notice of those people who have slagged off the hotel, they are talking rubbish! It obviously isn't cheap, but if you want to stay somewhere for a special occasion (ours was a 40th birthday treat), the Ritz cannot be beaten. We have also stayed at the Meurice which is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and room.”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: Lots of character and awesome indoor pool. Room was beautiful and spacious, service was great. Enjoyed indoor heated pool every day after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. Would definetley recommend a saty here at least once for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “to Ritz or not to Ritz anymore....”
Reviews.Author: Er_Daddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz and had some expectation, i must say. The hotel is located in Place Vendome, that i consider one of the most elegant square in the world. We had been staying few nights earlier in the Park Hyatt Vendome that is located few meters faraway in direction of the Opera. In comparison i would go back definitively to the Hyatt, not to the Ritz. Nothing to say against it, but at the end i did not get a good feeling with the hotel. Mainly it was the attitude of the people. And I did not like the entry of the hotel with almost no lobby The room was big and well decorated (not properly my style, but nice). It is an Historical Hotel, but at the price thay are now charging i will def go back to the George V or to the Park Hyatt.... i did not try their food so cannot give any advice on that.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment The Ritz is NOT anywhere near the best”
Reviews.Author: CowboyChefSB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for our honeymoon spending the money for a nicer suite. It was a complete let down. People were making noise all night, room service completely failed in every aspect. It was like a bad movie and the staff did very little to accommodate us. Huge disappointment. i would rather stay anywhere else but the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “over-rated”
Reviews.Author: rc51
Reviews.Content: The name of the Ritz is synonymous withe the best of Paris but sadly it nows trades on its old reputation when it was French owned. The staff are generally not up to expectations although some are very good and the look of the hotel in some areas is rather kitch rather than tasteful. Room was comfortable but not exceptional and the food ridiculously overpriced. There are far better hotels in Paris nowadays, e.g. Crillon, Bristol etc. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: GlobeSniffer
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ritz. Room: We stayed in a deluxe suite. The room was spacious. I really liked the bathroom fittings. Everything was over the top. Opulent! Isn't that what the Ritz is all about? Want something modern/updated? Then go to Las Vegas. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. No noise. Food: Very good. Service: Good. However, just like you can rely on death and taxes as an inevitable part of life, you can rely on the fact that French waiters will always be rude, even at the Ritz! Bar Hemingway was fantastic. Loved it and not just because I'm starstruck, overly sentimental or fooled into believing that Hemingway did anything more significant than get plastered there. The head bartender Colin Field lived up to his reputation. He is a master and deserves the title as the world's best barman. The drink he mixed was not only a work of art, but pure liquid gold. And as much as he mixes (no pun intended) with the rich and famous who frequent the Ritz and Bar Hemingway, he was quite happy to get down and dirty and engage in polite conversation with us regular folk. I loved everything about the Ritz in Paris. It's fabulous. Will certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adeded
Reviews.Content: Since i was a child, my family has always stayed at the Ritz. The most previous time, we booked 2 suites and 4 bedrooms for our family. The other time we had the elton john and the windsor suite! Both times the expierience was wonderful.The food is excellent. The staff wonderful. There is a lovely putting green in an area with a bar scene at night. Expensive though, 20 dollars per person to rent equipment. A world-famous health spa and pool lives up to its reputation. The ambiance of the Ritz is to be desired. From the resteraunt, the hemingway and vendome bar and everything else in the hotel, style and grace exudes. I would highly reccomend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed with the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller086
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and tired. In great need of refurbishment and a "refreshment "of their front desk and consierge staff. Prices for using the hotel car are ridiculous. 200 euros for airport pickup, while a regular cab will cost 50 euros And eating at the hotel will set you back 9 euros per a regular cup of coffe and 80 euros for gazpacho soup and a soggy caesar salad. The front end service staff, unfortunately exhibit the same attitude best exhibited by disenfranchised Paris waiters. Younger, friendlier and more helpful staff would be a welcome change . The location is excellent and walking distance to major Paris sights, nevertheless there are some smaller hotels around the corner and in the area where I would stay before I ever came back to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype - outdated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MelSW18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz in Paris for a night in June on business as my usual hotel (Renaissance at la Defense) was fully booked. I was reasonably excited at the prospect of staying at such an iconic establishment, but I have to say, I was almost entirely under-awed by my experience. From the snooty reception and concierge staff, to the TINY room, the whole hotel gave the impression of leveraging off it's name, rather than actually offering a decent standard of accomodation and service. Perhaps the Ritz isn't targeting western european business travellers, it would certainly seem that their larger clientele now comes from the middle east and Africa, and perhaps the 'old school opulence' works for these guests. From a western perspective, however, the pastel pink mongrammed bath towels, the golden swan-shaped taps (i'm not kidding) and the ornate baroque lamps next to the bed just seemed overdone, worn around the edges and quite frankly, a bit tacky. It's not just the decor though! 78EUR for a steak and chips on room service, with 9EUR for sides of vegetables is laughable. My 14EUR can of Heineken from the minibar didn't jump out, open itself and give me a massage, as I would expect for that price and the 1.5hr wait (and 4 phone calls) to get my television to work properly is frankly unacceptable. Now I am not a diva, nor am I used to the best hotels in the world, but modern chains like Marriott, Hilton and Westin knock the socks off this crumbling old grandmother clinging to a spot in central Paris and maintaining it's status through the tack-loving dollars of middle eastern consumers.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Karin246
Reviews.Content: We took the most expensive rooms, several of them to accommodate our extended family. Not impressed. The hotel itself is lovely but everything is old and I don't mean the wonderful antiques, but bath fixtures coming off the wall, the hotel door that would not open again and again (the staff that would keep us hours waiting), the old, dirty rugs, the dust everywhere. A very long wait for room-service. Definitely NOT the quality of service that one expects when staying at the Ritz. We enjoyed the restaurants for lunch, and dinner, as well as for breakfast and the food was wonderful! Some staff members were very friendly and helpful, others were outrageous. We are an unassuming, happy family, who just want to enjoy the great museums, art and culture. We enjoy the nice things in life without being pedantic, so it comes as a great surprise to find such a landmark and expensive hotel not being what one expects.

Reviews.Title: “In love with The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: CharleyToronto
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at The Ritz for three nights in February. It was everything I thought it would be. The service was excellent and the room was incredible ( we were upgraded without any mention). The location is the best in Paris! I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “christmas at the ritz: magnificent beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: teacher050
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I spent three amazing days at the Ritz to celebrate the Christmas holiday in 2006. We arrived several hours in advance of the check-in time and were shown to our room at once. From our very first encounters with the staff (doormen, bellmen, front desk staff) we knew this was going to be an absolutely fabulous stay. The young man at the front desk was warm and solicitous (I should add here that my family is American, but French speaking), and went out of his way to get us into our room within minutes of our very early arrival. He accompanied us to our room, which was drop dead gorgeous, made sure everything was to our satisfaction. We requested, and got, a deluxe double room with a king bed and rollaway, which was so beautiful it looked nothing like a rollaway. The bathroom was huge with magnificent, thick peach colored towels. Everything gleamed and sparkled, especially the swan tub and sink fixtures. Because we arrived on Christmas eve, the hotel was simply beautiful with holiday decorations. Understated and elegant. An unexpected bonus came at 11:45 at night, when a housekeeper brought a huge poinsettia to our room, which she placed on the mantle above the fireplace. Our experiences at the Espadon were perfect, with the same kind of friendly, warm, and solicitous attention we saw in the entire staff. Other wonderful attention came from the attendants at the pool and spa. I have visited Paris 23 times since 1980 and make a hobby of staying at various deluxe properties in France. My stay at the Ritz was the nicest of all.

Reviews.Title: “A total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Abegweit1
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. We added The Ritz to our itinerary because most of the reviews rated it as the finest hotel in Europe. Maybe we overhyped it in our minds, but I have rarely been so let down by a brand. We were made to feel that the hotel was living on the grandness of its past reputation. The service was not what we expected -- they actually made mistakes with our reservation - giving us a smoking room when we asked and confirmed non-smoking - and they missed little things like the newspaper we ordered or the fact that it was my wife's birthday but instead a card was delivered celebrating our anniversary. While the hotel and our room were beautiful, it just felt tired and unfriendly and while my criticism seems trivial, it is the little things you would expect a place like the Ritz to be all over. We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe during the early part of our trip and the service there more then trumped what we received from the Ritz. When you factor in cost, that is where The Ritz really disappoints. We picked the Ritz more than willing to pay for the experience of staying at one of the finest hotels in the world. We paid through the nose but the Ritz did not deliver its end of the bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, As Usual”
Reviews.Author: AWoodard
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Ritz. Each time the service seems to have improved. Of course arrival at the elegant square where the Ritz is located, Place Vendome, makes you feel special anyway. But when my wife, 7 year old daughter and I saw our room we were blown away. The staff had even provided our daughter with some lovely presents which were already waiting in the room. Also, we had been upgraded to an "apartment" overlooking a courtyard, and when we opened the magnificent double doors to let in some fresh air we could hear little French children playing at their school during recess. It made us feel like we really lived there. We have friends who stay at the Four Seasons, and that is a beautiful place. But the Four Seasons seems more like a hectic business stop for Americans. The quiet chic feel of the Ritz makes it so different. We'll never stay anywhere else. You really feel like you are staying as a guest in a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed...”
Reviews.Author: Rachivo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 1 night at the Ritz. Disappointed sums up the hotel. The reception area was fantastic, the rooms were not. The room was tired, small and cold. Teh bathroom was unbearably hot, small and old fashioned. We waited half an hour for breakfast (scrambeled eggs) and had to leave hungry as our car was waiting (there was only 2 other tables at breakfast as it was very early). All in all dissapointed and would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable experience!”
Reviews.Author: MissNicky
Reviews.Content: Well after a few years of dreaming about going to the Ritz my husband and I finally made it all the way there from Australia to celebrate my 30th birthday. Before going I read the reviews on here and they seemed somewhat mixed and I had average expectations as I was concerned it may just be trading off its name and that it would be full of wannabees and "look at me's". How happy I am to say that this was so not the case. Let me just say that we went in winter which certainly may have made it a lot less quiet and pleasant but anyway. Always a few downsides though so here goes. Checked in and was told our suite wouldnt be available for another hour so, would we like to have a drink in the Vendome bar. So a bit peeved about late check-in (which made it 4pm - and that we had to have a drink on our own wallet - this has happened at other hotels and we've been given a drink voucher which wouldve been lovely and very much appreciated. About 4.15 was told our room was ready. I cringed at our room being the one right next to the lift and with pretty good reason - we heard the lift quite a bit throughout our 5 day stay but it wasnt too bad. Our suite was absolutely stunning with a large, separate and beautifully furnished lounge room with 2 terraces opening out onto a view of the eiffel tower which we werent expecting! So, gazing at this through the day and the hourly light show through the night was breathtaking. Our suite looked out over a boxed-in courtyard which made it very quiet and serene. Hard to beleive we were in the middle of such a huge bustling city. We were expecting some sort of welcome drink (champagne?) or sweets but there was nothng. Someone came in an hour later and delivered a plate of little cakes. There was no complimnetary water or anything else which you'd expect in such a professional - and expensive - place. This was the only complimentry thing we received throughout our stay. The room certainly exceeded our expectations. Huge comfy bed, beautiful lighting, quite large bathroom, beaufitul toiletries, fluffy pink Ritz robes and slippers. Minibar was a little disappointing with not much on offer. And housekeeping throughout our stay was really quite slack. Came back to our room each day around 4pm and room still not done. They came around 5 or 6. One day they forgot to give us more soap and shampoo which we'd run out of. Turn down service at night very disappointing. Nothing left on the bed but a breakfast menu. I've never not received a chocolate on a turn down service before. In-room dining was a wonderful experience. Very efficient and food prepared in our room. Had an amazing slow-cooked lamb shoulder for 2 with pistachio rice and a bottle of chilled champagne and the following morning exquisite french toast with ice-cream, all just as ordered. They didnt collect our breakfast table until 5pm even though we rang straight after breakfast so we had to put up with it in our room all day - it was too big for us to get it out the door. Dining at the Ritz restaurants is wonderful. Aftenoon tea at the Bar Vendome was our ritual each afternoon at 4pm where we slowly grazed for 2 hours on all the different delicacies. Breakfast - included in price - was a very sophisticated affair. Its called a buffet but you actually choose all the things you want from a menu and they deliver it all to your table. As soon as a mouthful of coffee was drunk our cups were topped up, as soon as a croissant was eaten another one was put in our bakery basket. And they dont rush you out no matter how many people are queueing to get in. We had a 4hour dinner at L'Espadon which was honestty the most wonderful dining experience of my life. 3 courses so professionally cooked and served by such lovely waiters followed by a cheese trolley that you can pick as much as you like from. Had caviar and truffles for the first time in my life which I'll always remember. Overall it was 5 days of bliss and I cant wait to return hopefully in the not too distant future. There were a few "peevs" but we tended to focus on them more due to the rate we were paying but they certainly didnt dampen the experince that much. If you're dreaming of going - do it! We loved the place so much we only ventured out into the city for one day. It was just a pleasure to be either in our gorgeous suite relaxing, wandering through the lobby or having a drink or some gastronomical delight in one of the intimate little spots available. Also the Ritz Bar - not the Hemingway bar (too bright and small!) but the bar on the right is ultra-cool. Great chill-out music wth amazing tapa's and cocktails - they have their own homemade Baileys - it was wonderful! Well done Ritz - you did not disappoint!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastergirl
Reviews.Content: Everybody should stay at the Paris Ritz at least once in there lives. It was everything I'd imagined and more. When I arrived I couldn't wait to see my Suite it was on the 5th floor and had a lovely sitting room with a fireplace desk comfy lounges and Cezanne painting on the wall I hoped it was an original but it probably wasn't. We can dream though! The rooms are just as I'd imagined, old styled furniture thick sofas rich fabrics beautiful artwork etc. We had a separate bedroom with the most comfortable bed and two lovely long french windows with a balcony overlooking the Restaurant Courtyard which through the day was frequented by some really artistic and creative sort of people even though I didn't know who they where I imagined they were famous designers and wives of the politicians and the elite Parisian people. Next door you could hear children playing in one of the private schools on the block it was truly lovely. The Ritz is situated in the loveliest part of all of Paris with beautiful boutiques carrying the finest that France has to offer. You can walk pretty much everywhere from this location. If your a fashionista like myself you can visit the world famous Chanel Boutique Rue Cambon just 1 street away and have your purchases waiting in your room for you, pretty special! We never really saw any staff or chambermaids they seemed to know when you were in or out and worked around us. The room products were so special and we had 2 mini-bars 1 in each room and I must say they were the best stocked bars that I've ever seen. They bathroom was stocked with the best products, and there were lots of cables and buttons in your room and in the bathroom which you can call the chambermaids for help. Everything was amazing even down to the gold swan taps. The concierge was brilliant they arranged all our ongoing things for us and also having them confirm our arrangement seemed to work much better than me trying to do it myself so if you need anything ask the concierge they seem to be in the know with everyone and the arrangements through them were spot on. We were given VIP treatment at Charles De Gualle Airport with there arrangements and a lovely room upgrade at our next hotel all from the Ritz's fine concierge. I can see why the rich and famous frequent this establishment they feel safe and protected I know I did. There seemed to be security everywhere and they all looked like secret service agents if you were not supposed to be in the hotel they'd be straight on to you they have a strict no filming or photo policy which they do police vigorously (yes i did get caught) I was given lovely gifts everyday that I stayed there (5 days in total) Lovely chocolates little cakes and biscuits a lovely book on the history of the Ritz everyday there was something nice in my Suite. I have stayed in some of the most beautiful hotels around the world and I have no complaints I couldn't fault the Ritz and I can see why they have the impressive reputation that they have. I can now die a happy woman. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Thanks goodness I wasn't put off by the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: EJ1968
Reviews.Content: I'd always wanted to spend the first night of my honeymoon at the Ritz, but when I read some of the "bad" reviews on Trip Advisor I was put off. Thank goodness a friend said "You know, the plumbing might be a bit dodgy or the stairs a bit creaky, but hey it's The Ritz". So I booked the honeymoon package and didn't regret a single cent spent on our stay. From the moment we arrived looking like derelicts after 30+ hours of travel, the service was impeccable and never pretentious. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite and it was breathtaking. We had breakfast in the restaurant and the service never skipped a beat. Our waiter was lovely and made us feel very special. We were even given a late 2pm checkout so had a chance to enjoy the room for even longer than we expected. All I can see is, don't think twice about staying at The Ritz. The expectations I had built up over years were more than exceeded.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise for my 50th birthday from my very generous brother Dave”
Reviews.Author: bravaragazza
Reviews.Content: My brother took myself,my daughter, his partner and my little niece as a surprise for my birthday and his partner's birthday. I was under the impression we were staying at the Paris Hilton near the Arche de Triomphe. The metro were on strike the weekend we arrived, so we had a long bus ride from the airport to Gare du Nord. We then waited for a while for a couple of taxis. It was then that my brother informed me about our stay in the Ritz. I was very impressed with the building inside and out. The concierge was very friendly. The rooms were beautifully decorated and the beds very comfortable. We ate out at a nearby Italian restaurant which we all enjoyed. The waiter was excellent with my little niece. She did not like to sit still for too long!! All the staff that we met in the hotel were very polite and friendly. The only negative thing that I could mention is that I felt the pool was rather on the cool side and on departure my brother was charged for a car parking space. This was corrected immediately however. Our taxi driver who we had used on the previous day, arranged to pick us up to take us back to the airport. He was very friendly and an excellent driver. I really enjoyed the experience. Paris is beautiful and I would love to return one day, perhaps for my brother's 50th birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay, but don't think I will next time”
Reviews.Author: Tokyodude
Reviews.Content: I was staying at a different hotel in Paris, but when I passed by this landmark hotel, I decide to take a look to see what it looked like and to find out if I would like to stay here the next time I'm in Paris. As soon as I walked in, an elderly hotel man stops me and asks me in French something. I asked him if he spoke English, which he didn't (which surpirsed me for a hotel of Ritz class), but figured out that he wanted to know if I was going to the bar or the resturant. I told him that I wanted to see the hotel, but he didn't understand me so I just moved on down to the main lobby. There wasn't much space to see, although it was nicely appointed. The hotel man who originally stopped me kept on looking at me suspiciously and he came up to me again and said in English, "Looking?, No looking!. You out!" I obliged politely, but the way he kept on looking at me and the treatment that I got made me feel that I never want to stay at this hotel. I understand that this is a landmark hotel and that they don't want group of tourists going through there, but I was traveling alone on business and was trying to discretely look at the hotel to find out if I want to actually stay there next time. I've been to other world class hotels where they would gladly show you actual rooms if you asked for it. Besides, that was a first time I was kicked out of a hotel lobby just for being there.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: selbbub
Reviews.Content: We arrived slightly unsure what to expect having read reviews here, opinions seem to be at the extremes. We arrived at 12, but couldn't get into our room until 3, but the staff offered us alternatives. we went to the galleries lafayette instead for a lunch and look around and came back about 4. The desk manager asked if we had stayed there before and as we hadn't gave us a full tour. The room was magnificent, the bathroom a joy. we didn't eat at the ritz but we did go to Hemingway's bar where we were very well looked after.. The staff throughout were excellent in every department, especially at breakfast. Yes there were minor things, but then there always are wherever you stay. An excellent stay of three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Such a grand old Dame.”
Reviews.Author: travellingKoalas
Reviews.Content: It is pleasing to know that when wanting to celebrate a special occasion, in this case, my wife's birthday, there are some truely exceptional places to stay in. The Ritz in Paris is, to my mind, one of them. Forget large intercontinental types of hotels, where you unhappily mingle with badged conference people; The Ritz has kept its essence, and 'raison d'etre' when it was created; to be a home away from home. And what a home! Having booked a deluxe room via Amex platinium, I was offered on checking in, to be upgraded to a junior suite; so I was shown the deluxe room first, then the vast junior suite, with it's separate living room. Well, would you believe, I decided to go for the deluxe room,; and for a simple reason. The junior suites generally overlook one of the hotel's smallish, inner courtyard, whereas, the better deluxe rooms are at the front, overlooking the legendary Place Vendome. The reason why those deluxe rooms are in a better position is because, I was told, this is where all the grand, royal suites are loctated, and so the rooms can be used to connect with the suites if needs be. This means that those deluxe rooms are staggeringly beautiful, with huge ceiling heights, stunning chandeliers and gold-leaf detailing; One really feels steeped in history, in Marie Antoinette settings, as if falling asleep in a bedroom in Versaille. And that is the 'forte' of this hotel; (unlike the Ritz in London, where I also stayed, which really is nothing special at all). Service was near ennough perfect, just the right blend of friendliness and professionalism; with a very good room-service, and an excellent housekeeping who, when asked for some extra body lotion, delivered them so discreetly into the bathroom that we never even knew she came. On the subject, the bathroom products were 'la Prairie', the best of the best, according to my wife, and she should know. Also, what a wonderfully large and deep bathtub, and those little swan-shaped taps and thick peach-coloured towels added to the overall experience. No separate shower, though. So no negatives at all ? Well alright, one or two litlle things, just to confirm that perfection does simply not exist. First, the pool was not all that great; nice to have in the middle of Paris, but it isn't big enough to take more than a maximum of three swimmers doing lenghts, at a time, so you just have to wait your turn for someone to come out . (the web's photo would have you believe that it is much bigger than it actually is, which is a bit naughty) Also the changing/locker rooms are cramped and uninvinting. And the only drawbacks I could find in the bedroom was the faint whirr from one of the nearby lifts, when it was in use, and also the imposibility to work out the heating system, as the many handsome brass switches were very confusing, and it got far too hot in the night. Still, it is a five star experience, especially if shared with the right person.

Reviews.Title: “loved the pool and spa”
Reviews.Author: ParisJohnparis
Reviews.Content: stayed for a conference work paid and I loved it all If you are looking for an executive hotel this is the one

Reviews.Title: “Special stay, everything you expect and more”
Reviews.Author: steveandalixoz
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the time we left the stay was fabulous. All the staff we had contact with made us feel special. What an experience, stay here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “No late check-out!”
Reviews.Author: Nicomedian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at an executive suit at the Ritz for two nights. The suite was very impressive, well decorated, a large living room and a larger bedroom - with a huge king bed and a sofa. There were two FULL bathrooms . The pool is probably one of the largest pools in among Paris hotels. SPA is also great . Very good Bali massage. Service was excellent. You can ask for the housekeeping to come and clean up your room ANY TIME during the day. Also you can have breakfast in your room no matter what the time of the day it is. Overall, great experience. The only negative thing was the check out - latest by noon time and my request to extend for one hojur was refused .

Reviews.Title: “Great Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Battersea_dweller
Reviews.Content: I am aquainted with the Ritz and the Dorchester in London so I had a pretty good idea of what to expect (hopefully) before I arrived at the Ritz in Paris. I therefore was not intending to be disappointed if it did not exceed my expectations, as long as it did meet them. Ofcourse, places like the Ritz are always going to plunder your credit card quite deeply but if you feel that you've had an exceptional and special time then it can be viewed as reasonable value for money. Upon arriving, I checked in with a very kindly looking receptionist who indulged my wish to try out my French very politely. He took our two small cases and led us to the lift (so far so good). What he didn't mention beforehand was that the Junior Suite Deluxe we had reserved (basically a nice big room) had been upgraded to an Executive Suite with two bathrooms. The view of the gardens below was lovely and the rooms in the suite were exactly as I had hoped. Nice touch to have taps resembling swans spewing water out of their mouths! I dug my hands in my pockets and forked out more than my usual tip for such a treat. Some people say that there is always a risk of tipping too much in France but I've never heard the recipients complain about it, or offer worse service as a consequence. The TV welcomed us by name, as did a hand written card, although they had assumed that I was coming with my wife which amused my partner enormously. That was the only minor drawback and it did not offend me to be honest. Room service was perfected executed on both occasions I used it. They arrived within reasonable time and served with a flourish. Everyone in the hotel who would be in a position to speak to guests speaks good English but they also don't mind you having a go in the local language if you want. In the Espadon restaurant in the hotel, the service was professional and friendly. I decided to push the boat out and have the "menu decouverte", involving nine small courses. The multi-lingual staff presented the tasting menu that we ordered at a very good pace, explaining what each course was and accompanying each one with a glass of wine to perfectly compliment the flavours. Seven glasses of wine later I was feeling very happy indeed with the dinner and the evening in general. The food is delicious, with excellent sauces, but don't expect to be stuffed by the end - huge portions is an Anglo-Saxon feature which us Brits and Americans could do well to abandon. The next day we had a snack in the Vendome bar. Again the staff were friendly and welcoming which was fast becoming the norm for the hotel workers. The decor and opulence of the rooms and corridors is pretty much the same as the Ritz in London; it's very Louis 16th, which I like. If you appreciate this style you'll be impressed with the attention to detail and lavish designs. If you like your bed firm then that might be a problem for you as my one was a bit on the soft side but it was exquisitely dressed and, ofcourse, the maid turned it down before bedtime. Finally, we checked out and let a doorman hail a taxi for us and put our cases in the boot of the car (another tip but I didn't mind). I had read a couple of very negative reviews on this website from other guests of the Ritz in Paris, which had alarmed me a bit before I arrived there. Now I am just a little perturbed - my experience was perfect (I am reasonably familiar with the five star industry so I don't think that I am particularly easily impressed). Maybe I was lucky but I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is the Pitz”
Reviews.Author: scooby19
Reviews.Content: It is with great disappointment that I write this negative review of the Ritz in Paris. I've stayed in many similar caliber hotels in the world -- this hotel just didn't meet the standards of a luxury hotel. Let me say first that if judged on looks alone, the Ritz is absolutely beautiful..but there is little substance under the beauty. Service at breakfast was horrible. I was served first, my husband nearly 20 minutes later. No explanation provided. We had to ask for coffee -- it was a good 15 minutes after we were seated when we finally got a cup -- served in very chipped coffee cups. The centerpiece on the table was broken and the napkins were stained. One would be much more forgiving in a propertly where breakfast of oatmeal and fried eggs didn't cost $150. When we complained, we got a call early in the afternoon the next day for an offer to buy us breakfast THAT day -- needless to say by 1pm we had already had breakfast ! No further effort was made. The Spa, touted as one of the best in Paris left lots to be desired. Absolutely zero service. The showers in the ladies side had not been serviced ditto for the poolside lounge chairs. Pretty gross. There was no water anywhere except in a water cooler just outside the locker room. None was offered before or after the massage. There was no "relaxation room" to wait in prior to treatment. Just two chairs stationed in a hallway outside the treatment room as though you were waiting outside the principal's office -- just terrible. Zero amenities in this Spa. We were told that usually the spa has much more "energy" to it. Well allrighty then! What a ridiculous explanation. We were offered the hotel car for a ride to dinner one night. Once outside there was a rather heated debate beftween the doorman and the conceirge. Apparently the hotel car was promised to another guest -- it was very awkward standing there while they decided who the lucky guest would be! We won that battle, but then realized it was literally a 2 minute ride. All that fuss over a 4 minute round trip ride. Unbelievable! Service at Hemmingways Bar was similarly sad. We went in for a cocktail and it was obvious that the bartender didn't feel like working as we were the only two guests in the place. We did not choose to have any further meals at the hotel after that. This will change for next year, as France will be going smoke free as well. But... beware cigar smoking is all the rage at this hotel with the exception of the hallways in the lobby leading to the restaurant and the bars. This hotel, unlike other luxury hotels is not careful with hotel transfers. We arranged for a transfer to the airport on check out and were placed in a filthy, banged up taxi. Just awful. A couple of positive highlights though -- the concierge recommended two restaurantes for dinner and both were superb and presented two very different dining experiences. The second high point -- the bed. So comfortable that you actually consider staying in it rather than hitting the town! Finally, location cannot be beaten -- Next time however, we will stay at the Maurice or the Four Seasons George V- I am sorry that I opted for the Ritz and will not make that same mistake twice. A hotel of this caliber and this expense should really clean up its act. There are so many other choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz ...unbelievable !!”
Reviews.Author: ballymoreboy
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful hotel ...such service is rare ... The benchmark for quality .... And all this at the same price as the most overrated hotel in Europe - The Danieli Venice .. The manager of the latter should stay here for a night and see how its done .. The Ritz ..C' est manifique !!!

Reviews.Title: “Comme Ci, Comme Ca”
Reviews.Author: Connecticutians
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday. Have never written a hotel review before, but I relied on this site in choosing the Ritz, and had a somewhat different experience than what was described. I am not one of those fussy, super-critical folks, but the Ritz did not meet my expectations in several areas. The bad: 1. Concierge service was awful. Not only did they not contact me before my arrival, they insisted I use e-mail when I called to arrange transportation from the airport. Then they did not respond to two e-mails. While there, it was amazing how often they were flat wrong about things they told us. They were also the only people who really seemed snotty to us in the hotel. To top it off, the night before leaving, we made arrangements for a late check out and transportation to the airport: the car came six hours early, did not come with child safety seats as requested, and the late check-out memo was lost. In short, of the six or seven things we asked them, they screwed up five of them. 2. Kids. One of the main reasons we chose the Ritz was reading about how well they treated kids. But our kids did not receive a "welcome gift", as their own materials promised, and there seemed to be no special attention to them. They seemed to look at our kids as a potential annoyance to their "important" guests. Far from "greeting them by name", the only special greetings we got were asking if we were registered guests. And the five or six doormen on duty did not leap to open the non-revolving side door for our stroller, even when we were obviously struggling. 3. Cost. Paris is very expensive right now, but this place is out of control. Brunch and room service dinner for our family of six the first day were over $500 each. And $35 a day for internet access! 4. No water in our kids' bathroom the first night. They did give us half off on the room that night, though. The Good: 1. Very comfortable beds, and excellent bathrooms. 2. Very good location, almost perfect. 3. Quiet and clean in both public and private areas. 4. When our daughter got sick the last night at 2 a.m., two sympathetic, uniformed chambermaids arrived to change the linens within five minutes. We had such a good time on the trip that it's hard to be too negative. But the concierges are absolutely useless, and we didn't experience any of those "special touches" that others have raved about.

Reviews.Title: “l espadon restaurant”
Reviews.Author: huitres
Reviews.Content: Fantastic setting. Arrived at 8 and were escorted to a great table. Only 15 tables in restaurant so service is excellent. Superb wine list. Good range available for as little as 25 pounds. Had the tasting menu for 180 euro. Really good value. Started with canapes. Staff not stuffy or rude like cheaper French restaurants. My partner is vegetarian and they prepared a great tasting menu for her. Only criticism was dessert which was a bit of a disappointment. Nothing extraordinary but then this is only a one star establishment. Overall the experience was amazing. Alot of history in this place! Bill was 370 euro including wine and coffees. Not too bad for a place like this. Certainly better value than Ducasse. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “God Bless the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Europe ( my first and my partner's 5th time in Paris). This was both business and pleasure and we spent hours doing research and planning for our stay. Our one major hesitation was that the grand dame might have been past her prime, sort of like New York's Park Plaza before it closed when it was yellow and frayed around the edges. Well we are happy to report that this place ROCKS BIG TIME! We were blessed with a fantastic room, and the service, the environment, all made us feel at home, royally. The Ritz is a living classic, a legend that is still very much alive. Why not be part of history? Staying at the Ritz the past and the present come together, as if the Mona Lisa could still smile and talk to you. I recommend buying into the most delux accommodations you can afford in order to get a great room, one with the super high ceilings located in the old part of the building. The concierges were wonderful and helped us get into the BEST restaurants. The place is central to EVERYTHING and we walked easily to THE LOUVRE and to the MUSEE D'ORSAY as well as GOYARDS. I was also afraid its location in the plaza would be cold in sterile, but really it is rather intimate in scale and although lacking in vegetation and color, the plaza's striking and bold BRONZE monument adds plenty of greenery. The spa is a luxurous catacomb of ancient ambience and quiet mystery. We had breakfast in the room with the windows open, which felt like the most exclusive table in town. The Ritz is an experience you will never forget. Our only complaint is that it was so seductive; it was difficult to leave to see the rest of Paris. You have to do the research too. BUY the zagat, michelin, and timeout guides and read them, and you have to be willing to splurge and let go and be open to the experience or go somewhere else. Use the spa, get a facial. go swimming this is the place to do it all. After paying the bill, I felt I got a bargain thats how spectacular it was! If you get the breakfast deal get it delilvered to your room, you will happier! Remember to tip and be friendly to the wonderful staff. They are the Best. You have to see it with you own eyes and live the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like nowhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My three days at the Ritz were such a lark I must have had a stupid grin on my face the whole time. Comfortable, beautiful room; friendly, helpful service; and the best location in town. (And what a town.)

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: batw
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas in adjoining Executive rooms. Everything you would expect and more. The personal service was exceptional. Every employee makes eye contact and greets you as they pass. Even a maintenance employee changing a lightbulb at 2.00am stopped to greet us individually. The rooms were spacious with an abundance of complimentary bathroom products. The Kids were given Christmas stockings, a gift and a visit to the pastry kitchen to participate in a festive cookie class. Breakfast was very good, although perhaps slightly rushed on Christmas morning. I don't undertand the complaint from another review regarding the worst seating near the exit. The restaurant is in a secluded end of the hotel lobby. It's impossible to have a bad seat. Everything at the Ritz is discreet, however you cannot help but get a rush when you step outside to see tourists taking photos, or brushing past Woody Allen and Soon Yi around the Christmas tree.
